5gZhHci2vZ5FjYh55dCWTQ.text: Everything you want in a restaurant- clean, nice ambience, great service, and REALLY tasty and fresh food. Also - many gluten free options including fried rice! Portion sizes are very generous. Will be back for sure, probably a lot if this is the usual experience!  If you like to spice up your food yourself - ask for the hot tray.

UfcWNFEyhZZsWs01fpZbKA.text: Great spot for fresh Thai food in the Henderson area. I have had the pad se ew noodle dish, panang curry, and chicken pad Thai. All have been non-greasy and seasoned well. If you don't like things spicy, you can request the spice level to be zero. The Butterfly Pea Lemongrass Drink is my favorite here. It has a hint of lemongrass and comes in blue, but when you squeeze the lemon in and mix it, it turns purple!   I have not dined inside, but have mostly gone in for pick ups for to go orders. With its growing popularity, dinner time can get busy, but you can always call ahead for pick up. The restaurant is very clean and well decorated as well. There is a T.V. on usually playing sports which I like. There is a mixed lot of people from families to couples dining in, so the place is great for a variety of occasions. There is also a section in the menu that is vegan friendly. So there is something for everyone. Will be coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken pad se ew to go.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan pad Thai to go.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Thai beef jerky to go.

PcN0SNJLi51t9C5zPSbWDQ.text: I cannot get over how amazing this place is. I could probably eat here every day.   Their vegan dishes are out of this world. I don't even know how they make their curry so flavorful without fish sauce, but they do it somehow!   Service is quick. Staff is nice. They're almost always busy, but I guess that's what happens when you serve delicious yet healthy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Paradise salad. Slightly tart and sweet. So refreshing.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried eggplant appetizers. SO GOOD. Crispy on the outside, but creamy goodness on the inside.

m4vWMm9RSz7zhmGVf5juCQ.text: I was looking forward to trying this place based on the reviews and I must say I was not impressed. Went with family on a crowded Mother's Day, hoping to get my Thai fix. The wait was horrendous which is to be expected considering the holiday, so we ordered to go.   My favorite item was honestly the fried wontons , lol. They were crunchy and so tasty. I could have eaten an entire order and been happy. The pad Thai was not very good. Noodles were a bit over cooked and the flavor was just okay. The beef broccoli was not great either. Daughter who loves this dish refused to touch it. I can see the appeal considering portions were good and there are many vegan options but we won't be going back.   Gave one start for cleanliness/nice restaurant, one for the wontons and one for the decent service we got when ordering and picking up.

mUufqTcyWqQAEpDhFgwiAw.text: I can't believe I didn't know about this place sooner, it so good! The food is interesting and tasty with a huge selection of vegan and vegetarian options. I've been a few times now and everything I've tried has been delicious. The staff are efficient but friendly, very helpful. I've only tried one dessert so far-the coconut "ice cream" but it was really good. I'm always surprised at how many good restaurants hide out in strip malls in Vegas, this is no exception. Highly recommend.

kUsBICeG3iVsIFd1hPT4iA.text: Bring a party of two. The food here is delicious and they give you a good amount of it. This is probably my favorite Thai restaurant now & I'm really picky when it comes to that. I had their yellow shrimp curry, pineapple fried rice, and Springs rolls. Let me start out by saying that the curry was delicious and is now my favorite. You chose your level heat (I don't know how high it goes), but for my curry I chose a  level of six on the heat scale, so it was still spicy, but not too overwhelming to where I couldn't eat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellow Chicken Curry, Pineapple Fried Rice, &amp; Spring Rolls.

4yuxcTrYXed23AH46KrkcQ.text: Bomb food at a bomb price. First time here and was pleasantly surprised. The red curry was great. And so was the roti.

GB4Xc6KBO2goaktTTY-j7w.text: The restaurant has a modern and clean interior, with one TV that was showing the basketball game during my visit.   I ordered the Pad Se Ew with chicken and spicy level 5 (out of 10). The food was pretty good, nothing "ew" about the pad se ew. For it being medium spicy, it was a little bit on the spicier side.  Customer service was great. My water was refilled often and I was asked if everything was okay with my order. The employees seemed to genuinely care that customers have a good experience here.  I will probably be back for their lunch special. Not too sure if I'm accurate but I think it's from 11AM to 3PM, with the entrees being $6-$7. So I guess I will pad see ew later, Thailicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

QQ_XVfMuqUOauLqdmwDbJA.text: Food is fresh but 2nd time in a row I have been here and ordered drunken noodles with spicy level 7 and it came with spicy level 0.  So frustrating.  I live 15 minutes away so by time I get home to discover the issue, it's too late.  At least this time my food was hot, last time it was cold because their estimate for it being done was way off.  Very frustrated with a place that has so much potential.

oCnT6whS-ZQw1ujeHXB8qQ.text: My favorite Thai place in Henderson !   Such great lunch specials. Go for lunch.  I'm partial to the orange chicken and pad see ewe. The orange chicken is out of this world with how crunchy it is, and their pad see ewe is always made perfectly with seasoning and noodle texture.   Their salad dressings are eh, but truly that can't affect how great their entrees are!   My favorite spot, and you can tell with how busy they always are so anticipate possibly waiting for seating. There's a yummy boba place in the plaza if you need to kill time. Overall bomb dot com.

XEnoO2rK_D_QM4GpW3GyxA.text: Great vegan food! Always fresh great customer service! I recommend trying the soy orange chicken it's amazing and also the spring rolls

vpQPt5rOmBRe4Foq8Az-BA.text: This Thai restaurant is amazing!!! My coworkers and I will order lunch specials and their panang curry is so delicious and so authentic! The best Thai restaurant in town!

XM7iJkSgx-tvz6R81sC-sA.text: First of all, let me say they make some of the best Khao Soi I've ever had, and that was after visiting Thailand 8 times for work. The food is exceptional.   However, the staff could use an attitude adjustment. We paid for take out and went on an errand, planning to come back and pick it up. When we arrived, both staff members made sure to tell us how long we were gone.  They claimed we left for an hour, which was impossible, because we ordered our food at 4:10 after and came back by 4:50pm. I know it wasn't within 15 minutes, but since we paid for it already, I'm not sure why they felt the need to insult us a little.   I won't go back there, but it has nothing to do with the food. Staff should be courteous and considerate of all their customers. Ordering takeout and paying for it in advance, means we are coming back. Take it easy on us. We all had a hard day, just as you and would just like to pick up some yummy food, without being treated like that.

hBfXiWDVqMaDy-dLuR4NLA.text: So my friend took me out for a late lunch and I got to pick & wanted a new experience. Well...great job because we really loved our food & tried several menu items. The vibe is very cool & laid back and server was helpful with the menu and service was quick. Tried corn cakes and eggplant appetizers, our favorite being the corn cakes. Shared pad se-ew with chicken and green curry with tofu. We loved both and a spice level 5 was solid spicy right where we enjoyed it. To go we took an order of chicken fried rice which they customized since it was for a child, no problem very accommodating. We left knowing this will be our new place to take everyone we know who enjoys good Thai food. The menu is inventive and diverse and I cannot wait to try something new next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Pad se-ew noodles with chicken
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggplant appetizer
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Interior dining room

zQN_oVyUNVTsLDfbR5USQw.text: By far the best Thai food that I have had in Vegas. Fresh and great prices. We ordered from postmates then went in for lunch last week. It's great. The food is fresh and flavored really well. I got a 5 spicy and it was actually spicy which is great. Will definitely be ordering more. They also have lunch specials that are really good!

rLh2nsBexsnarTCIYb92ig.text: Delicious neighborhood Thai restaurant.  I've ordered takeout many times and have really enjoyed everything.  Pad Thai, Pad se ew, Penang, and the soup.

3Uyv65uXsPbLVdymk-m7Hg.text: Surprise find.  Met a friend in the area and googled vegan for her.  Found this Thai with reasonably priced lunch specials.    The combo came with a spring roll and salad, these were underwhelming.  But I never eat the bag salads or frozen spring rolls anywhere.    When asked for level of spice, I said I like spicy, but not burning and was surprised when suggested a 3/10.  Well, it was spicy.  Good spicy.  But spicy.  Probably not authentic and I'm not a versed Thai eater.   But was a tasty and well priced lunch for the area.   I would return.

-9-p4LYjZZe5xWXSWsOulg.text: Thailicious offered good Thai food. I didn't think it was anything to write home about, but it was definitely tasty. We ordered the fried catfish, yellow curry and some fried rice. The yellow curry was really good but I would probably steer clear of the catfish next time. I'll be back to try something else soon!

aNgw62VVb9hguFDkD0cesQ.text: Really good local Thai, we enjoy their curries and the Pad Thai.  However, the fried rice is always rather dry and flavorless compared to other places in town.

6z8NZC_0GYSoOD41MfWvUQ.text: Delicious food, great ambiance, great customer service, loved everything about this place. We tried a few items off the Vegan menu.  Tom yum soup: broth was surprisingly very flavorful. However, the huge chunks of vegetables were not practical for eating in a soup. That being said, I would probably still order this again since the broth was yum!  Vegan fried rice: by the looks of it, it seemed pretty plain, but man was it good. Probably my favorite dish of the night! So much flavor infused into the rice. Definitely recommend! Vegan chowmein: well made. Good ratio of noodles to veggies. Also very flavorful. On a side note, if you ask for spicy, expect it to be spicy! I love that they didn't skimp on the spice for me  Overall, glad we discovered this little place, definitely will be back. Wish they would open a location in Las vegas!

n30HFFRsbdXJuaK_GAKsww.text: Bomb! So good... great vegan options. This will be my new spot. Service was fast and amazing

0eGZfHGbNuzXHr_PhImaRw.text: Excellent!!!! Thai PLUS Vegan=full heart and full tummy. They have both regular and vegan options here and the food taste amazing. They were very accommodating when we didn't realize a dish had onions-they changed it a re-did the dish without any issues. This is my second time already and won't be my last!

IVLv0NRevx-WB8hAkYZeCg.text: Amazing food and eat till you can't take it anymore.

oK9cLVcF3vAdvZwrGMdk2A.text: This place has really good authentic food.  The restaurant is built really well from what i see and i love the pic of the  thai scenery on the far wall..  Great ambience and the costumer service was really good. Dutch made you feel appreciated.    I will def come back here

hUFBCXwxiBMCjyxCWW4T1w.text: Best vegan food I've tried so far. Curry was a little spicy at a three but tasted amazing! We ate so fast I couldn't take a picture! Staff was on point with service and water refills. Def check this place out of you get a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

wuTYmxYqK2v4t0YxWDn-rQ.text: Amazing food!! Everything we tried (Thai beef jerky, 2 different soups, chicken pad see ew and lemongrass tea) was so delicious and full of flavor. I usually add chili to just about everything I eat but I didn't need to add anything because the flavors were so good. The restaurant itself is pretty and clean and the staff was very helpful. So excited this is close to our house, we'll be back for sure!

QqLXt3qAAf_hH0Txgfb4PA.text: Fantastic fresh and amazing thai food. Super fast and friendly service. Wouldnt go anywhere else

xO51LJPBfQXQtxBRXqCWEQ.text: Yes, this Thai restaurant does get a 4 stars for me. It's wonderful to find local restaurants in your neighborhood meet outstanding quality control with their food. The reason it's 4 and not 5 is because of their service. They are quite busy and the staff multitasks constantly. They need more staff to help out with the volume they receive at dinner time. BUT, the food is simply delicious! A "bit pricey," but they have quality ingredients.

2ABYlvAn3zc-7fu-DNvB6g.text: Probably my favorite Thai place in Vegas right now. I went here on a Sunday night dinner with my whole family and we ordered about 8 different dishes, all of which were excellent. The Thai chicken bbq, Thai beef jerky, eggplant, and catfish were probably my favorites. The mango sticky rice was also very good. The place is very clean and the service was exceptional. If there's one criticism I can give, it is that they don't have much choices in their menus compared to other Thai restaurants. Nonetheless, they have the best flavors (quality over quantity!). My family and I are definitely coming back.

-ZMrXw9XzYy_5tsarJ5Z9Q.text: Found this restaurant completely by chance using the monocle feature. Figuring I like Thai and my daughter is a vegetarian it was a place to try. Glad we did. Place was pretty full when we got there but we're seated right away. By the time we left there was a line out the door. One guy in line said that he has been there every week since they opened. My daughter had the Green Curry, I had the Pad Kra Pao and we took an order of Mongolian Beef to go home for the wife. It was all excellent. We will definitely put this on our list of places to revisit with friends and family. My suggestion is go early rather than late or else expect a wait. It's worth it though.

VfhF5borT6Qq3KybvsqcQQ.text: Great Thai food. Tried various dishes and loved them all. Very clean restaurant and we had fantastic service. Will definitely be back again.

_dRkUAj3jnxJaN7hCKLgPQ.text: The best red duck curry I have ever eaten. I was expecting run of the mill Thai food when I wandered in solely because I happened to be nearby.   Nothing really tipped it off it was going to be more until my food hit the table and I stared at it in shock.   It looked significantly better than any red curry I have ever been served. Then it 100% lived up to that on taste.  They don't have many tables. Like they said in the movie Jaws " You're gonna need a bigger boat". This place is going to get swarmed.

cWUdYg8AiAlgReH1VINVOw.text: Great food, awesome vegan options.............,. Friendly staff........... Always busy.............look forward to coming back soon.............!!

BdWtgWyOfDEuxPRx3NVeOw.text: New Thai restaurant opened close to me so I had to give it a try when my son-in-law, who share my love of Thai, visited. The three of us all got different lunch specials. All very good. Good sized portions for lunch. Lots of things I want to come back and try for dinner. Wait staff was very attentive and was constantly filling my glass with water, which was very important because their spicy scale runs pretty hot. They have a 1-10 scale. My five had me sweating on the top of my bald head. Felt more like a 7 from most places. My son-in-law's 4 made him wish it was a 3, while my daughter couldn't eat her 3 wishing she ordered a 1.

J9V3kBXXu7En6dBRhGhoOA.text: We discovered this spot via Yelp and we were not disappointed!  The Thai teas are delicious!  The curries are amazing and we love that you can control the spice level.  My youngest loves the shrimp chow mein...he would prefer less bok choy and more shrimp.  I've had the duck red curry twice and I love it!  My husband loves the avocado green curry.  The fried wontons and crispy and tasty.  We have dined in restaurant and dine take out.  This is one of our new favorites for sure!

DO3NgJQueGBD2vyQcwKKGw.text: Just left Thailicious, it was delicious!  Many options to choose from, clean, ambiance, big portions, fresh and hot both in temperature and spice~we will definitely be back.

pqT-m4b-FrMQLMMpsUJtTw.text: I must admit that I have yet to find a better Thai restaurant than Komol. I'm a little biased as that's the Thai food that I grew up with and always prefer. But I was pleasantly surprised to see that Dutch (the owner of Komol's nephew) opened up his own place and I knew that with his experience with his uncle it had to be good. It wasn't just good, it was probably the best Thai food I've ever had. The vegan menu is incredible and the flavors were on point! We ordered several vegan appetizers, a salad and a curry. The butterfly pea lemongrass juice was a new and exciting drink for me and I'm already craving more. Hoping for lots of success with the new spot. A must eat if you're in Las Vegas/Henderson. If I could give them more stars I would.

tstuWF3k4bsDL32t9a-aQw.text: Really flavorful authentic Thai cuisine. Excellent service. Great value. Will be coming back.

jJLRHVsNifIi6uLB6LHNLQ.text: Food is great!! Love it. It a very small place and they're service isn't good due to it being so busy. Now we know just to order take out. Great food and clean place

tkNm5vtMDnxKJVsB01yO2A.text: Stopped in for a late lunch last week and we were just in time for the lunch special which consisted of 8 or 9 different entree options, soup or salad and an egg roll. When our food came out, we could not stop talking about how delicious the food we were enjoying was. My coworkers have been trying to get me to try this place for a few weeks now and they were right-it was fabulous! Lots of vegan options on the menu although I had the pad see ew and my friend had the pad thai, both with chicken. Definitely recommend this place, it's going to be your new favorite Thai spot!

ak1-yyfPAavwd2j_gstC3A.text: Walked into thailicious with high expectations after reading the great reviews. The person behind the counter never greeted anyone in our group or the group before. He just said "seating for 4?" And walked us to a table and left the menus stacked at the center. We ordered food and after waiting twenty minutes it arrived and the my pad see we arrived. It was a small portion for the price and undercooked . Rather then continuing to eat it, we just asked for the check and left. Too many other Thai locations in town with better service and food.

C0Y0uP0CcNe5z-uDzLdO0w.text: office decided to try this place for lunch the lady who answers the phone super rude.  it was all our 1st time calling and ordering here,  i have questions about the vegan items and how spicy things are she rushed me off the phone didn't tell my total or when i should go get our food.  i called back to ask them to make sure an item was not spicey and they ignored didn't answer. Not sure if it was because the rude lady didn't want to talk to me. but what restaurant doesnt answer their phone during lunch time  . I called 3 times they she answered YES?? so im trying to not take it personal but well it felt personal .  I picked up my food it was sitting for who knows how long. not under a heat lamp getting getting cold and soggy. cool! I got the eggplant it was really soggy.  I got the pad thai veggie lunch special there was 1 piece of broccoli, but it tasted pretty good. minus there was no veggies.....eggroll was soggy and cold.  basically the only hott thing we got was my soup Veggie Tom Kah and that wasn't good either was lacking flavor, needed more coconut milk it was very very watered down..no lemongrass flavor, nothing.  maybe we just caught them on an off day, i wanted to love this place but well this first impression sucked .  quest for good vegan food continues.

vP8IAaIYi2QtOuN-OJcZ0A.text: I've eaten at a lot of Thai places, but this one by far has been the best! The food here is great and authentic, the people are amazingly friendly and feel like family, and the service is awesome with everyone on top of everything. 10/10 recommend to anyone!!

S__8km6qyoLH8nPNQ8TH0g.text: Delicious.  We tried the Mongolian beef and green curry chicken. They were both excellent and came with a side of rice.  We also tried the Thai Tea and it was heavenly.  We never had it before and wow. Also it's Vegan - who knew.  So good and the gentleman waiting on us was lovely.  He spent time connecting with us and making us feel very welcome.  We can't wait for a return visit soon.

X6E8_eCjSS971Kn6O2XzGg.text: First time visiting today for lunch and the Pad Thai was amazing as well as the mixed veggies.  The spice level 6 was hot but oh so tasty. This is definitely my new favorite place to eat!!!! Thank u for coming to Henderson.  The staff is wonderful too!

6cK01uYLpzVuiFJ0ec9n4w.text: This place is great, and I'm so glad they are down the street. What I can't rave about more is the service. I only ordered take out, but I was asked by two separate people if I needed water while I waited. I ordered for my family, who all enjoy varies spice levels, and they hit every point. Ordered the cashew chicken level one and it still had great flavor, and no heat. Beef pad see ew a level four and it had slight heat. I ordered my yellow curry a level nine. I am used to most Thai restaurants really holding back on the spice and usually order pretty spicy because of it, but this curry is HOT. I feel like for once I finally got a spice level I actually ordered. The restaurant is clean with modern furnishings. The staff is wonderful. The food is great. Def a must stop for Thai food in Henderson.

tqadHRnbCcMxd4DOpYlHKQ.text: When we walked into this place, there was only one other customer, a man, who was having dinner. We were greeted in a friendly manner, and seated quickly. After looking over the menu and ordering our beverages, two other customers came in and sat near us. About 5-10 minutes later more customers arrived. Our order still had not been taken. We sat while another server tended to customers who arrived after us. Finally our server came and took our order. Our appetizer came out fairly quick and was delicious. Some time later one out of the two meals we ordered came out. After waiting for an extended period of time, and after noticing everyone that arrived AFTER us was getting their food, we asked to speak to a manager. The response we got was shocking. We were told that food is cooked in two separate parts of kitchen. Wait, What? What does that have to do with my meal not being brought out and everyone else getting THEIR food? Then another employee came out to explain "sorry, the cook is slow". Wait, your making excuses for bad service? That's just not acceptable. The cook is slow but everyone else that arrived after us got their food??? That's just BAD SERVICE. It's a shame because the food was good. No effort was made to rectify the problem, just excuses. Very disappointing.

wASEKjO6zXR4yF6pycAewQ.text: highly recommended for lunch and dinner, good food and quick service, very attentive and on top of things. good if your looking for a quick place to grab a bite !

CA0o6IydwkBR8DTEuygenw.text: I love this place, my boyfriend and I have been coming here every week sometimes 2-3 times a week, lol. It is very new and clean. It is a small venue but I have seen it on a busy night and they accommodate everyone. I have dined in and taken out and all I can say is good quality food and excellent service. I usually order the yellow curry with chicken(spicy 8/10) or the drunken noodle(spicy 8/10). If you like spicy they definitely come full force. Usually when I go to other Thai restaurants I have to ask for the highest rating of spice because apparently they don't understand my love for spicy food but here it is the perfect amount of heat that is not unbearable. And they are very good on filling up my glass of water which is something I appreciate. And they constantly check up on me to make sure everything is okay even on a busy night. I think one of the best things about this place is that they even offer vegan dishes that taste great. My boyfriend sometimes orders the tofu Mongolian dish and I have tried it, I have to say it was very good. Every time I have order food even for takeout, it has been served extremely fast. I have caught myself being very impressed with how quick our food has come out many times. This is my new favorite restaurant and I am proud to be a satisfied customer!

_PQI-q_4sR-ZLawT_rM9Eg.text: So so so good. I have eaten at many Thai restaurants and this was, by far, the best. I can tell they are using quality ingredients. Service was good. We ordered the Papaya Salad - it was large and very good. We also ordered the Drunken Noodle dish - it was probably the best Drunken Noodle I have ever had. We had the Sea Bass with fried basil (I can't recall the name of that one - but it was just perfect), and we ordered the Avocado Green Curry - again, it was amazing. And we had a coconut soup with vegetables. It was perfectly seasoned and really good. We ordered everything vegan (except the fish) and our party shared it all. We also had three vegan desserts - the chocolate cheesecake, fried banana with coconut ice cream and mango sticky rice. All three desserts were stellar. We will be back. FIVE entrees and three desserts + green tea for everyone came to around $80. That's a pretty low price for such good food. I was impressed.

xDryUEA3gtYnOu0ZmSTqKQ.text: You know a place is good when you leave and find that you can't stop thinking about how excited you are to eat your left overs... I do not have much experience within veganism, but Thailicious certainly gives it a good name. I had the avocado green curry at a 6/10 spice level, and it was exactly what I had hoped for. A smidge spicier than medium, with excellent flavors and a variety of textures (with the avocado and peppers). The service was very friendly and attentive, the prices were reasonable, and the portions were spot on. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

QhyCTj8avjJfg-jQ3hYgMA.text: Great food. The service was ok, one of our dishes came in and we had ordered two pad Thais and we kept waiting for them, we asked where they were and say said that we haven't ordered them, so that was annoying but once they fixed that and brought us our order it was fantastic!!!

SGwamk2EucQ5JVTwQ8DuNg.text: I really liked this place! the presentation of the bowl of wonton soup was great and it tasted even better! we also got the fried rice with chicken and spicy chili garlic sauce and it was really good. service was pretty fast although it was busy and prices were very reasonable for portion sizes! i'll definitely come back and try more food

pPiBA_YkB4syfR7mYN2afQ.text: I really loved this restaurant.  Eating here was a happy accident.  I've lived in Henderson for a year and 3 months.  When we first moved we had quite the struggle finding great food.  Thailicious came up in a search with great reviews but it is not close to home so we never ventured out.  My husband and I decided to go to the gym today (I haven't been in more than 6 months) and I was starving after.  I did a Yelp search for the area and Thailicious popped up.    The best thing is that the reviews are accurate.  The restaurant looks clean.  The decor is modern.  They had nice music and the World Series of Poker was playing on the television.  I've been meaning to improve my Poker skills so this was perfect.    I ordered the yellow curry mostly because I wanted potatoes.  The waitress said I could have just had the potatoes in the green one, but I didn't want to be a high maintenance customer.  I order a hot level of six because I wasn't sure what hot actually is for this place.  I like hot, hot food.  I think it's only been twice in my life when someone said a fish would set your mouth on fire and it actually did. Once eating Shrimp Diablo in Cali at some dive joint that set my pants on fire and another time at a Korean Barbecue while eating a random appetizer.  I think they set you on fire there so you'll leave and stop the AYCE.  The number 6 for me was mild.  I'll try an 8 next time for comfortably spicy.    I also had a Thai Iced Tea.  I've never really liked this drink but it's something my husband would normally drink.  It sounded refreshing this day.  I enjoyed it for once.  Most places that he gets his tea from has a bitter brew.  This tasted strong but not old.  I'm not a fan of the bitter stuff.   We order the crab delight (Rangoon) appetizer.  The presentation was pretty.  I swiped the flower and took it home and it now is living in my meditation room.  They prices were small but delicious.    Hubby got the chicken satay to go as he wasn't hungry.  Poor thing missed out.  I like my food hot and fresh.  He said it was, "Okay."  I'm sure if he had been in the mood for Thai and hungry it would have been more than okay.    All righty folks.  That's all I've got.  Wait! I have left overs so I've got this and that.    Ciao! Enjoy Thailicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellow Curry with chicken, beef, and shrimp, hot level of 6. Delicious!
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab Delight

E4Av47grkLmcSUeB56isjw.text: The best Thai food in town.  In a town with kick-ass Thai food--this one is best!  Service is outstanding!  Food phenomenal!  Flavorful, fresh, many vegan options.  Been here a lot and am always impressed.  This time had curry, chicken fried rice, Tom yum, vegan Thai beef jerky.    Came back for the 49th time.  Still my favorite in town.  Service, flavor, consistency.  Outstanding!!!!

9hgjSQeZ5SGSUFaIAV9blQ.text: Have been happy with our previous visits and maybe we made some poor choices this time, but if you can't do it then remove it from the menu. Still get a soup or salad with your lunch. Not sure they are staffed appropriately for how busy it was. Orange chicken was basically fried breading. So tight it was barely edible. The chicken, if there was any in most of the pieces was cut way too thin. Second was the shrimp. My wife ordered had that with shrimp, for a $1.50 upcharge. 3 shrimp and they were not extra jumbo sized to justify the cost.

LFU2uulK_qvWU2KrFK9IqA.text: This place is amazing...especially during lunch! They offer a great lunch menu and even better prices. I paid $8 for a spring roll, soup and pad thai. Their lunch special is $6.99 but for $1.50 more I added shrimp to my pad thai.   I thought the flavor was great and the portion was hearty. I left feeling satisfied and wanting to come back a second time to try more of their offerings. When I opened the menu I was literally struggling to find something to order because everything looked really good.   I am def coming back to this place. The service was fast and friendly. Thank you!

VeSocf8hxeVCIn-NYhMm8g.text: I ordered the pineapple rice and wanted to add meatless orange chicken on top with the fried spinach. However instead of charging me to 'add' a protein to my rice for 2.99 they charged me for a whole order of meatless orange chicken. They did give big portions which was cool so I didn't complain;...... however.... I ended up getting super sick and was in the bathroom all night viewing my dinner once again.

ckb_Vm0-VHK702jkbTYTwQ.text: I recently relocated to Henderson from the Southwest part of Vegas so I had to find a new thai spot to scratch my regular curry itch. I got lucky that this place just so happens to be within walking distance of my apartment!  My go to is the Yellow Curry but I have had their Panang Curry, Red Curry, Tom Yum Kai Soup, Drunken Noodles, Duck Red Curry, and Beef Massaman Curry. Everything has always been delicious, inexpensive, and of a perfect portion size.  I do all of my meals as pickup orders and there is always someone available to answer the phone and my orders are ready within 10 minutes.   My only complaint about Thailicious would be that when I order my food a 10/10 on the spice scale, it's not as spicy as other thai spots level 10 is. I would say their 10 is more of a 7, but because the dishes are so flavorful I don't miss the heat so much.

A3q1tojSW8j7pRbxOqkS0A.text: Henderson's choices of Thai restaurants are so few and in between, and most of the few ones aren't that good and not worth going back to.  There are some in betweens (e.g. Penn's Thai and Naga) but just a bit of a drive from Green Valley that I'd sometimes postpone my cravings and wait until I get to central Vegas.    I came across Thailicious serendipitously on a very cold late Sunday night  when my cravings for something hot and spicy kicked in.    I thought about pho but I had pho the day prior to so i opted for Thai soup.    The place was packed.  We didn't have to wait to be seated for long though.  But after we were seated, we had to wait and flagged down one of the wait staff to get our orders.   In fairness, the staff were very cordial and friendly.  The food came and were served (and plated with thai orchid) in a very timely manner.  We ordered 6 dishes in total but only "cleaned" 3 serving plates.  -  Seafood Tom Yum was loaded with seafood. It was very good.  There was a perfect balance of the amount of broth and the protein.   It was coconut-creamy, tamarind-sour, palm sugar-sweet, nam pla-salty and thai bird chili-spicy but we scooped and ladled right away so we ended up having and eating/slurping a whop-whop lukewarm soup :(.  That was our fault!.  Yet, we cleaned the pot they served the soup in.   - Beef Jerky was well seasoned and peppery, but not jerky enough.  It came across as just a  deep fried marinated beef strips.  The serving was measly, but the dipping sauce that came with it was very good.   - Phad Pri King  was very standard.  We asked for medium heat but it came heat-free.  It was good but I wished it was dryer and not with a watery red curry sauce.  We had to doggy bag half of the dish.   - Pineapple Fried Rice was interesting.  They added their own touch and they were very generous with cashew nuts and raisins.  Half of the plate,ended up in a doggy bag.    - Beef Panang Curry was my least favorite in our spread.  It seemed as though the meat and the potatoes were pre-cooked and were added on to and tossed with the curry sauce prior to plating.  We didn't finish the dish and doggy bagged it, too.   - Lastly, I ordered Pad See Ewe when the rest wanted Pad Thai.  Pad See Ewe is my standard Thai noodle dish.  This is the dish I always order when trying new Thai restaurants and the one dish that puts a Thai restaurant on my "will go back and will return" list.  Pad See Ewe introduced me to Thai cuisine when I had no idea what Thai food was.  Suffice to say, Thailicious' pad see ewe was good.  The sen yai were perfectly cooked, the amalgamation of nam pla and dark soy sauce was to my liking, and the serving portion was shareable.  I just wished they used gai- lan (which is currently cheap and in season and are so readily available in local Asian stores)  instead of the regular steamed brocolli florets.  The guy manning the cashier (maybe the manager, and the owner too) stopped by our table a couple of times and asked us  (a) how was everything (b) if we were locals (c) and told us that they do deliver within 3 miles.  I'd recommend them and I'm definitely coming back (cause I'd like to try their som tum and see if it's as good as mine).

2r_Qx6BrbcAmGDxWvdsCnA.text: UPDATE June 7, 2019 Thank you THAILICIOUS  for starting off my birthday weekend RIGHT!! We just had a GREAT experience here tonight.  The food was so tasty and fresh! Everything perfectly cooked!  I had a bowl of the Tom Kha Veggie soup and it could be the best I've ever had. Honestly! I started a vegan Detox program/diet last week and I am psyched to know I can come here and find something healthy, yet so very delicious to eat without straying from the plan.  Their fresh tofu rolls are a refreshing starter.  Though I didn't eat any of my daughters veggie chow mein noodles, I did pick at the lightly sauteed , al dente vegetables on top.  Husband ALMOST ordered one of their interesting looking fish dishes, but ended up going for his usual ORANGE CHICKEN which he said was really good. We finished with a delightful mango sticky rice desert that they kindly topped with a bday candle and a dollop of whipped cream. Everything was super flavorful! All of this matched with this gorgeously green  drink they call THAI ICED GREEN TEA that had the most unique floral flavor I really enjoyed. WE WILL BE BACK:Sooner than later   OLD REVIEW BELOW:  Ugh I'm so sorry I have to give this establishment a 3 today, especially since my first review many months ago was a 5. Why only a 3? Burnt Shrimp Pad Thai! If we had been dining in the actual restaurant, then maybe we could've asked for a remake, but since it was a take out meal, the  whole entree went straight into the trash can because we honestly couldn't stomach it, even the eggs had a dark slightly burnt black color to them. That burnt flavor overpowered the entire dish. It was The worst pad Thai I've  ever tried, which is so disappointing because we've enjoyed their pad Thai in the past and found it to be phenomenal. I'm hoping this was just a strange glitch that won't happen again. We'll certainly be back  because  the PANANG vegetable curry was tasty.  My husband enjoyed the orange chicken. The Thai iced was yummy, too.

lPWS347fCZgDDIZ3Oy94mw.text: If you like thai food minus the THAI, this is the place for you. After a long 10 hour drive we decided to try this place due to the over four hundred, 4.5 star reviews. We've never tasted more bland thai food in our lives, NEVER! Thai food is known for its fresh ingredients and robust flavors. I've been to a ton of thai restaurants and never have I been disappointed; this was a first. I'm visiting from California and this is the first thai restaurant I've been to, in Nevada. I don't know if it's a Nevada thing?? I ordered the Kra Pao fried rice with chicken, Kra Pao veggie fried rice, chicken wontons and veggie steam dumplings and two orders of sticky rice and mango. The chicken fried rice was absolutely bland. It tasted like all the ingredients were mixed together with no seasoning and grilled over fire. I ordered it mild and there was no spice whatsoever. The wontons were flat with very little meat. I felt like I was chewing mostly, pastry. Luckily I had sweet chili sauce to dip them in. I've never been to a thai restaurant that made the wontons flat???  My daughter had the veggie fried rice, dumplings and sticky rice and mango. Her veggie fried rice was just as bland as my rice. She ordered hers at spice level 6 and she tasted absolutely no spice, whatsoever. My daughter said the veggie dumplings were good; we have a winner. The mango and sticky rice was the only thing I enjoyed. We were so disappointed. I am still in disbelief of the taste of the food. It's so bad that we think they forgot ingredients while preparing both our dishes. I am not exaggerating, the rice didn't taste gross it tasted like, well nothing. I almost want to take the food back and ask them if they forgot ingredients while preparing it. It's baffling! Thai food with NO flavor???? We spent $50.00 on our meal.

XBeCsUD3DPPsQW4VNeXdfA.text: Very nice ambiance in here. Server was attentive and I was asked if the food was good or if it was too spicy. Friendly staff. They also had the game on the single TV, which I enjoyed. I wish the portions were a LITTLE bit bigger, but I will be back for the lunch specials!

TLTz1uhFeYBhMjcGAcpeOA.text: I ordered the drunken noodles and my wife ordered pad Thai. Both were delicious! The food came pretty quickly and the servers were friendly.

YgkLf5VYRcIULgnsGBjoQA.text: Shout out to the owner Gray Murillo for his Grand Opening!    I'm so glad that he opened up this restaurant!   The place was invitingly romantic and spacious. The service was on point and they were attentive to their customers. Our waters were refilled at reasonable times. They offered vegan suggestions and dishes if you're unsure of what to order. Dutch made sure that we had a pleasant experience.   We started off with an appetizer, crab wonton, papaya salad. And for the main dishes Pad Thai and Panang Curry.   Everything that we ordered were aesthetically pleasing.   The crab wontons were crispy with a lot cream cheese and a lot of love. With the papaya salad, the proportion was a lot bigger than expected. You're getting the worth for your money. Totally worth it. The shrimps that came with it were cooked just right. They made that simple dish 10x better.    A Thai restaurant isn't a Thai restaurant without Pad Thai and some Panang Curry! The texture of the noodles were perfect and it was really saucey. It wasn't dry like other Thai places.   For me, what brought everything together was the creaminess of the Panang curry. It had a dash of coconut milk right in the middle. And the crispness of the tofu and bell peppers went so well with the curry.   For dessert, we had mango sticky rice. The warmness of the rice paired well with the mango.   I highly recommend that you try this place. We are definitely coming back to try their other dishes.

Felt a little like when they turn the lights on after an evening at the bar and it's leaving time. I prefer a bit dimmer lighting at dinner time! Not a deal breaker though.

QNqmi6zZJZl8MAIyopheVg.text: I have been vegetarian for 2 years and ordered the Soy orange chicken , but when we got our check it just said orange chicken so I asked about it, oh no it's regular chicken  never going again . Now my stomach is turned upside down

_VFgKGodYGEme0zXEtnu6A.text: Husband chose this place for me to get take out from on way home and I was surprised because he never eats Thai. He saw some pics and reviews on Yelp and suggested it. I thought it was going to be like all the other asian places in town but was so pleasantly surprised with everything I needed to write a review. Pick-up was fast and easy which is super important to me. So nice they had two registers because a lot of people were picking up things. They said 20 minutes to pick up when I placed order. I got there about 15 min after placing my order, so I was a little early, but I paid and my food was ready right when I was done. Points for being on time. :) Everything was so fast and efficient. Most of all after I got home all our food was delish and fresh. My husband loved the chicken satay and my beef and broccoli was probably the best I've ever had. Super great flavor, perfectly cooked broccoli, good quality pieces of beef (not all gristly or weird like they can be sometimes) and the sauce wasn't all thick or sugary. My Tom Yum Veggie had tons of veggies and spicing was right on. Glad we found this place and looking forward to trying their other items soon!

iAui05oMWZNacLewyfim6w.text: I really don't like giving less than four stars for a restaurant that hasn't done anything horribly wrong in particular. Unfortunately I have to this time for reasons I'll explain shortly. The service was pretty good, the girl who helped us was super sweet and accommodating. The place itself is very beautiful on the inside and very comfy. The food is very authentic with the exception of one thing: spice level. Maybe I've been spoiled by all the delicious Thai and south East Asian restaurants in California, but i expect a 6 level spice to be a 6 and not a 1. I'll give them some credit for not assuming I can't handle spice and not asking me what level I want and just giving me whatever. She asked me what level for papaya salad, and I said 6 worrying that it would be too hot since Thai usually runs hot. I had to ask for a spice cart and dumped everything into the papaya salad. My mom had curry spice level 8, and it was more like a 2. Disappointing to say the least, just didn't seem right to me. Papaya salad has always been known to be spicy and this just didn't cut it. At least they used actual Thai spice rather than cayenne pepper like some other Thai places here.  This place is much better flavor wise than most hendertucky Thai places, but still doesn't cut it for spice level for me. I might give this place a second chance in the future, but I am going to ask for a 10 and if it comes level 1 I'm just going to be doubly disappointed.

BYbardeW06NR543jMiz84Q.text: We love this place! If you like Le Thai downtown, you'll love this place too! Happy there is some yummy Thai food over in Hendo with great service. Probably some of the nicest servers I've ever had at a Thai restaurant. LOVE that they have tons fo vegan options and you know that it is clean. The interior is cute considering the unassuming exterior.

WYFZ3HEqw3jKd7Dievp6yg.text: What a fantastic new Thai restaurant for Henderson!  Let's start with the ambiance, the restaurant has a nice warm and comfortable atmosphere. Some beautiful classic Thai artwork accompanied by a modern dining area. Upon arrival we were cheerfully greeted and seated promptly. I ordered a Thai tea and it was to die for! One of the best I've ever had and it's completely vegan!   We ordered a variety of dishes my favorites were their Beef Jerky appetizer(), Beef Pad Se Ew and Orange chicken. The Orange chicken is like no other it's got a wonderful crisp and a fantastic sweet orange sauce that tastes great with the rice.  In addition to those we ordered crispy spring rolls, seafood pad kee mao, krac pow chicken, drunken noodle, pork skewers and lard na. Everyone loved it all dishes had great authentic Thai flavors.   For desert we shared my favorite, mango with sweet sticky rice which was no disappointment and a perfect finish to a very fulfilling dinner. I cant wait to head back to Vegas to get my Thai food fix!

h_GKjtSCdsWSE6A7R6idlQ.text: Hello folks!! Was looking for another vegan place to eat. Of course I used Yelp to find this type of restaurant. And I saw Thailicious. I decided to pick something up from them after my appointment. I walk in and it's a very nice and clean place. The people were very friendly. So so far so good and this place has quite a few good reviews. I ordered off of their vegan portion of the menu. For my vegan folks lots of choices mainly all of them have tofu. I'm sure you can request the tofu to be withheld as I don't like tofu either. But you do have quite a few choices. I chose the Vegan egg rolls and the vegan pineapple fried rice. It took about 12 minutes from the time I ordered to the time I received my food. So that wasn't that bad. paid for my food and it cost $16.22. Looking at the food it was very tasty looking. I first started with the egg rolls because those are my favorite. They were crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. They were just whatever to me.. they weren't bad and they weren't great. They were just regular egg rolls. I also ordered their pineapple fried rice. Again it wasn't bad. It just wasn't great. Maybe I'm a bit stereotypical when it comes to Thai food. I expect big bold flavors and spice to clear your nasal passage. This wasn't spicy at all and  was just okay tasting. I feel a bit let down and Desiring Thai food because this place just didn't hit the spot. maybe they have different chefs at different times. I don't know.... my apologies Thailicious! I don't like to give low ratings. It's like being excited because of the previews for a movie and you go watch it and the only good parts were in the previews. If I could give any advice and not that you will take it as I'm no chef. I would say to pick bold flavors and spice it up. Good luck Thailicious!

tybYoKwBb9KgPb43C3EK9A.text: Great experience.   Had to run an errand on east side of town and needed to grab a bite to eat. The ratings of this restaurant said give it a try. Friendly staff match the warm ambience. Love the bonus purple flowers on my appetizer plate to spiff up the presentation as well. What an exclamation point!

KA4RUD6WpRa_IVkBBec1Xg.text: I am so glad we decided to stop in for a Friday night dinner. We were looking from something different from our norm and Thai food is definitely a scarcity for our palates... not anymore! This place is inviting, clean and the staff is very friendly. It's in a quiet shopping center with plenty of parking and from the outside doesn't look very lit, but it's noticeable once you walk up and see all the tables full.   Being new to Thai foods, we generally order the classic pad Thai and my boyfriend is very particular to his fried rice. We figured If they can hook us on that then we definitely can try venturing into curries, different noodle dishes and proteins. They passed the test!   We started with the wings and sticky rice which was a confusing combination to read but when we tried it we completely understood. There's something about that sticky rice, the sweet chili sauce on the side and the crispy outside of the wings.  My boyfriend ordered a Wonton soup and I was so jealous. This isn't your casual Chinese takeout wonton soup... this is a hearty, jam packed with veggies, soft chicken and shrimp in a savory broth with chewy, perfectly seasoned wontons... type of soup. 5/5 for thatin itself!   We couldn't decide on what to order so we decided to try their Shrimp pad Thai, the chicken fried rice and the Mongolian beef. Everything. Was. Delicious. I ordered a "4" in spice for my pad Thai and although it was a strong kick for me, I couldn't stop eating it. So much flavor, sort of layered. You get this spice note and then a slightly sweet later and then cool down with the lime squeezed on top, a tangy refresh for the spice.  The fried rice was fresh, you could taste the char on the onions and chicken, the rice was fluffy, seasoned very well and the portion was big.  The Mongolian beef was awesome! Not your expected Mongolian with the flour breading and a sticky, thick sweet sauce... No. This was fresh beef slices with thick cut onion and green peppers, in a sweet savory broth and topped with wonton strips. Something about that broth. So so so good.   Best part was the prices, we did not expect to spend what we did and we were so pleasantly surprised. We just had to take a take out menu to have at home for Thai nights in.   The service was good, a bit slow at first but picked up once some of the tables closed out. They were attentive, helpful and always around when we needed water to take the spices.   I highly recommend Thailicious and definitely plan to be back for a Thai fix soon!

VZ7DMcugKxOkMMfcsfF78A.text: Found a yummy Thai restaurant in Henderson and thought I try it out. And it's pretty good! My brother ordered the vegetarian tofu pad thai and my mom got the shrimp pad thai. I on the other hand got the yellow curry, and it's jam packed with flavor. What I like about this place is that it's vegan/vegetarian friendly and has a wide selection of entrees to serve both meat lovers and vegans/vegetarians. Their service is also fast and efficient! r5MsZAsH_IT7a-kXUecAMA.text: Their red curry and panang curry are TO DIE FOR. Definitely a must try! You absolutely will not regret it :) The addition of coconut milk gives the curries such an incredible richness and wonderfully sweet creaminess. You can choose your level of spice from 1-10 (I personally prefer my spice level to be somewhere between 3-4). Keep in mind that the coconut milk slightly dilutes the spice so I recommend going one level higher from what you'd normally get. All basic curries come with a choice of protein (chicken, pork, or beef. Shrimp costs extra) and a bowl of fluffy rice.   They offer an $8 lunch special menu Tuesday through Friday from 11 AM - 3 PM which includes an egg roll and either the soup of the day or salad along with your meal but to be honest I think ordering off the regular menu gives you a better bang for your buck.  Tips: Great selection of vegan options as well! Plenty of parking at all hours of the day. Located in the same plaza as EoS gym. Closed Mondays.  Overall, highly recommend for their amazing red curry and panang curry!

oOLXXYQYMCVH7_ASmJF5EQ.text: My friends has been telling me about this place since it opened! So, I finally went with a friend after the gym, since it was in the same complex, and we were super excited! The place was nice and small, and luckily when we got there, there wasn't a lot of people. We were seated right away, offered a drink and was handed a menu. The menu had soooo many options.. and my friend was super happy that they had a lot vegetarian options.   I got the pad Thai chicken (spice level 7) and Tom yum soup (spice level 5). NOTE to self next time; lower the spice level!!! The pad Thai was super spicy for me, and usually I do well with a lot of spice.   Overall, service was great, food was delicious and I think the location is even dangerously awesome, since it's about a two minute walk from the gym!

tx8AbClP2ljIFASKdxuUrQ.text: This new Thai restaurant has honestly let me down and I'm DISAPPOINTED with the CONSISTENCY of their food. The other day I ordered a Pad Thai with tofu and a Drunken Noodle with chicken for take-out. Both meals were made very poorly and tasted SOOO PLAIN! My drunken noodle looked like a bunch of flat rice noodles mixed in soy sauce. I asked for it to be level 7 spicy, but they probably forgot to add the spice in.   We couldn't go back to correct the problem and this isn't the first time they served me UNDERWHELMING food. For some reason, every time I ask for extra noodles they don't include enough seasoning to make it taste like real Thai food. Moving onto the Pad Thai, it's just as bad. Thailicious DOES NOT add enough flavor to make it authentic Thai food. It's very mild and you CANNOT taste the tamarind flavor. That is a very important component to enjoying Pad Thai.   The ONLY thing good enough to eat here is the CRISPY EGGPLANT appetizer. It comes with plum sauce and the eggplant is battered with tempera and deep fried to perfection. I can't imagine going back here any longer. I would rather go to VALLEY THAI any day of the week for authentic Thai food that has not disappointed me!

WpG1sZJ-UDIsW-yzSnHotA.text: Amazing Thai food that has both vegan and meat dishes! Came with my grandma on a Friday night and the place was filling up. We got a table and the service was friendly and amazing. I had the Thai iced coffee. Grandma had the hot tea, which is a jasmine green tea that she loved.   For a starter, we had the veggie fresh rolls with tofu. They were huge and delicious. I don't know what they put in their peanut sauce, but I wanted to eat a bowl of it alone. The roll was beautiful and had carrot, noodles, bean sprouts, lettuce, tofu, and herbs. It actually looked just like the photo in the menu book!  For dinner, I had the pad kra pao with chicken, which comes with a side of white rice. They do spice on a scale of 1-10. I picked a 4 and it was pretty spicy! Thailicious does NOT play around. I would say it was hotter than a serrano chili, but not painfully hot. It had such a depth of flavor that I kept eating. Thank God for the Thai iced coffee and the water they bring at the start of your meal! If you don't like spicy food, stick with a 1 or a 0.   I tried my grandma's cashew chicken and it was so delicious! There was a ton of chicken, plus carrots, onions, bell peppers, and cashews. The sauce was amazing and I wanted to keep eating it.   The meals are huge and could easily be two servings each. Definitely enough to share! Plus, dinner for two with an appetizer came to a whole $32 and we each had enough leftovers for another meal. This place is a steal! I'm definitely bringing my vegan friends when they come to visit. I love that they have a carefully thought out and extensive menu for vegans, rather than just one or two token dishes that seem like an afterthought!

T13CWTZflDWU30RZQMaiZA.text: Took my family here and we got Tom Kha soup, vegan pad Thai, chicken yellow curry, ginger sauce with chicken.   Huge portions, great atmosphere and extremely nice waitstaff. I took my handicapped grandpa and it was so nice at how easily accessible the restaurant is. The food is delicious and it is cool because they have TONS of vegan options that match the regular food options. The vegan pad thai has broccoli in it which is something I never knew I needed but it is definitely a delicious addition to the dish!   Definitely going again!

dXAsEYg_xTA5rVtkZNz_yg.text: This is one of our favorite Thai restaurants in the Southeast area. Their multiple vegan offerings are tasty, the service is always pleasant and professional, and their food it always delicious and well-presented. The only con here in my option is the small dining room. I wish it were a bit larger to accommodate more guests because it does get busy and the waiting area is not separate from the dining area - which makes it difficult to not watch the diners eat their meals.  Other than the small dining room, Thailicious consistently has earned a 5-star rating from me across the 5 or 6 times that I've dined here.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

eKSwb1Dv-S_CK5HA5HR6iQ.text: I was at this restaurant this weekend. I forgot to post it so I'm doing it now.  The customer service was good & the food was great! We didn't have to wait long at all to get our food. When it arrived, it loo ked and smelled delicious and the taste was very good! We shared the drunken noodles in which the taste was exquisite! The house fried rice was so amazing! It lots of meat in the b recipe.   My friend had the chicken pho and she said it was super good!   She ordered another dish for us to share but I can't recall the name of it. It was veggies & sliced beef. The taste was amazing! We then ordered sticky rice & mango. SO GOOD! I would definitely recommend this place.

nfiO_CX0wrvyzE1mgyg0Og.text: The staff at thailicious is amazing! They are welcoming and attentive. The place is clean and inviting. We have ordered take out and also dined in on numerous occasions and it is always good. The food is never overly greasy which most Asian cuisine tends to be. It is Very fresh and the food always looks appetizing. The price is also very reasonable. I wish I could give 4.5 stars because their really isn't anything bad to say about this place except a small deduction on the smaller type of shrimp they use and the taste being just slightly under as far as authenticity goes. But other than that a solid place to visit often.

UfqHi6elEW6BlvGcR8r8DQ.text: VEGAN REVIEW: There's a HUGE reason this place has a ton of EXCELLENT reviews! I will not flaw there mark too bad here.  The ambience is very nice and smells delicious when you walk in. There is a dedicated vegan menu which means they're not "we can make anything vegan, just ask".   What I liked: Crispy Eggplant - not over cooked and the sweet chili sauce they use, fantastic! Makes you craving more but then again what fried and sweet doesn't?  Mongolian Tofu - again, excellent sauce. We had it medium spicy and yowza! The onions were cooked well but crisp enough for freshness. Tofu not overfried  Panang Tofu - the serving size and both dishes were excellent. Lots of veggies with this dish and the sauce was not watery  Tea: Tea used here is Stassen Jasmine Green Tea and it's well caffeinated but not too potent  Portion Sizes and Pricing - get a to go box. Very generous portion sizes for the prices  What I didn't care for: Veggie Crispy Spring Rolls - these have the taste that reminds me of frozen spring rolls where you got a good crispy outside but mushy inside  That Day and The Day After - Both me and my partner had stomach issues. I couldn't sleep. Tossed the delicious food. Something was right...we can handle spice too. Not sure. Read other reviews just in case...  Neutral: Service- now they get packed from being so good so while the beginning was a bit slow we were checked on about 3x. That's pretty good for being busy. We didn't the goodbye when leaving but again, busy restaurant and great food  Overall: 3 stars for taste, ambience and quantity! I knocked off 2 stars for the stomach issues and crummy spring rolls.  I don't see us coming back again...maybe we will but ugh. My stomach!

v9aLeoN2EhZ0u2nxdM8fLQ.text: I came in during a busy lunch hour. The menu included many options for lunch special that was actually Thai food and not Chinese. Servings were large. The prices very reasonable. Many options for vegetarians. The food was served very quickly however the service was lacking. My particular waitress could not answer what type of vegetables were in a particular dish that I was considering ordering. I explained to her that I have allergies and needed to know. She gave me some what of an attitude and had to go ask the boss. Then after I ordered it, the dish came out without meat which is not what I wanted. They did give me chicken after the fact but the chicken was boiled and lacking in taste. I will give this a second shot because of other people's reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

omEfvMzCvgsN_UG4B2y9-A.text: Love love love Thailicious! We just moved to the neighborhood and ordered take-out last night... it will definitely be a staple for our family. I'm vegetarian so the amount of vegan options was a complete draw for me. We had the Tom Yum, Tom Kah, and the vegan Tom Kah soup... so delicious. We also had the dumplings and spring rolls... yum. For the main dishes we had the duck dish, cashew dish with chicken, and the vegan garlic fried rice. Honestly zero complaints! We will definitely be back!!

BA6Ydnv21jF8Iv8ekdYkxA.text: Thailicious is one of the top Thai restaurants in Henderson. You know it's good when it is constantly packed and there are plenty of to go orders going out.  One thing that is great about this place is that they have great vegan or vegetarian options.   You can't go wrong with anything here. I usually stick with mainstream items like pad thai, pad see ew, chicken satay, and yellow curry.  One appetizer that I love getting is the crispy spinach. It comes with two dipping sauces, one is of a sweet and sour variety, while the better one is a citrusy once that packs a lot of punch!  They have lunch specials!  Service has been consistently good here as well!

20MgqAiQVcVrdeEbCLq8Iw.text: Delicious Thai with Vegan options, best pad thai and the soup was delicious, lunch specials are under ten bucks so why go anywhere else?  No beer and wine though.  Not quite five star, service however I will upgrade depending on the next visit.

Vq7loCNfcd3aHxnkkmemWw.text: Nice decor. Friendly staff with the exception with one girl- she could learn to smile more. Food was delicious! I ordered the lunch special - vegan green curry. I also ordered for deliver the next day. My order arrived early by 15 minutes - good job! I ordered chicken panang curry, sprimp pad Thai and garlic sauce with chicken. My husband enjoyed it too. Will definitely be back for more!

iNQuIyY3HnZH53t5fa0Jxg.text: Be prepared to be surprised the first time you eat here!! This place is comparable to or better than any of the better known Thai eateries in the Valley!! I could eat their Drunken Noodles pretty much every day and never get tired of them. And their gelation flower dessert is something you have to try at least once!!

dkpxMpzWtxZL2hKZ0MIp3g.text: The food was good, but it came with consequences.  My wife and I have both been nauseous and stomach-ill since eating here 18 hours ago.  2-stars due to that and the fact that half of my noodles were stuck together and I had to cut pancake-like pieces to eat them.  Nice small clean place, but it's unlikely we'll return.

3YFFQN8p0uVThdoQzl75Ew.text: A new place with a good decor and plenty of choices. I ordered green curry with imitation meat. The flavors were good. However the imitation meat tasted like tofu pieces, without meat texture. We also had roti which was buttery but holding itself well. Overall, it is a good competition to my favorite Thai restaurant in town, Galanga but needs some improvement.

AKXoy9u3kChUPHc-WXGeEw.text: This place has one of the best vegan menus in Las Vegas! The owner is always there and it so friendly, and always making sure your meal is perfect. I love all the vegan choices and vegan desserts. My only wish is that they would serve alcohol.

GwqXjxBKWB42VJj-kByjCg.text: I came across this place on Yelp while looking for a different place to eat yesterday with the wife.  Reviews were good and it was relatively close to home.  After work we stopped by to give it a go.  I'm glad we did.  Both the wife an me enjoy Thai food and have frequent several venues in the valley (some misses, mostly hits).  This was a definite HIT!  I enjoyed their chicken pad thai while the wife had pad wan sen.  We shared crab meat fried rice (excellent) and ended the meal sharing a serving of vanilla ice cream.  Price point and serving sizes were very generous.  The staff was friendly and very attentive (something I always look at when dining out....it often is the deal breaker for return visits).  We will definitely be back for seconds and beyond.  Thank you so much for a great dining experience.

b-bsQ_UlPNTu3pmqMcRgvQ.text: Love this Thai restaurant!!!! It is hard to find great Thai food with great ambience, but this place has both! Amazing food with great, colorful presentation. I would most definitely recommend this place if you're searching for Thai food to dine in. This is for sure my new favorite Thai place in Henderson!

DqkURq59hBpxrTZZNH_lxQ.text: Wonderful food. Been there 3+ times now. Haven't been disappointed. Wasn't a fan of Currey before but they are making me a fan. Hint: make sure you give them a "Spice Rating " on your curry. I like spicy food, and a "4" works well for me. Nice family setting.

ErNHsYju5sOJmAPKAa3dRw.text: Fantastic!  They hit it out of the park.  Such a great vegan selection to choose from.  Everything was fresh.  The soy chicken satay were a great start to our meal.  The peanut sauce was amazing.  The drunken noodles and panang tofu were excellent.  We can't say enough good things about this place.  Definitely coming back very soon!!

XQDJXNWnYuWBaFNtSQlFsg.text: I live in the Northwest part of town but I was craving GOOD vegan Thai food and Thailicious did NOT disappoint! It was absolutely delicious and totally worth the drive!! I will absolutely be making the drive all the way to what feels like "the other end of the Earth" for their food again because it's more than worth it! Thank you for offering delicious food and for offering compassionate, vegan options!

50qB9bd3lqPDDUCg3eZcCw.text: This place is great. We love there drunken noodles and chicken satay!

-p-7MiQjeragFA0haMozVA.text: By far the best Thai restaurant I've been to. I've been to many Thai restaurants in Las Vegas, but this one has to be my favorite. To start off, the atmosphere and aura of the place was amazing. Very modern, hip, clean, and aesthetically pleasing --- but what tied it all together, despite how modern it is, were the authentic decorations that represented Thailand as a whole. Next, is the customer service. They were quick to greet me with a smile. Although there have been times where it was extremely busy, they always manage to offer me water, or reassure me that my table/waiting time will soon come to a shorten length. You can definitely tell that the owners are very involved in the restaurant because they have been there every time I have came. They don't  just make small talk with their customers, they make them feel like family. Lastly, comes the food. They amazed me with their dishes and appetizers. As you can tell from the pictures, it was definitely hard to just pick one appetizer. I tried the beef green curry on this night as well. The curries are beyond amazing and the beef pad se ew is also a favorite of mine. Their beef is very marinated and tender! My guests loved it here, as it was there first time. Their food has actually had me question if I should go vegan  their vegan options are amazing, I might just have to convert! From the setting, to the service, to the food --- Thailicious has become my #1 Thai food restaurant! I highly recommend trying it. Driving across town for it is most definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken yellow curry on the right (super yummy) and the beef green curry on the left (super super yummy)!!!
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. I couldn&#39;t JUST pick one appetizer! Here are the fried wontons (top), crab delight (left), fried eggplant (right).

aUUul9JyxvMY0ITISJlN0A.text: I've been here several times and I can say 4 stars is a good enough rating for this restaurant. Lunch special soup is pretty tasty but it always seem to be lukewarm. Tofu also seems to be slightly warm. I don't feel like the food is cooked to order since it's barely warm when I receive it. Pad sew ew is delicious, and the pho is amazing as well as the soy chicken but I didn't enjoy the pad Thai. Restaurant has a nice ambiance but seats are uncomfortable. Too claustrophobic for my liking.

7FFJKWC3jHILjT9TSX-B7Q.text: Friendly staff, great location and good spicy Thai food. Ordered Salmon cho Chee with spice level of 8 came out perfect for my palate.

BsohqbDsDdWkAdHPivbrgA.text: I read the write up for this location in the zip code magazine that is published monthly. Sounded like a great place so my husband and I went to check it out around 5:30 pm a few days ago. Unfortunately, we did not have the best experience. The restaurant was freezing (no heat). Everyone was eating wearing their jackets. There was a really loud group who sat and sat talking loudly and rude most of the time we were there.  The food was OK but since it was barely warm it was hard to decide. I mentioned it to our waiter who said he would heat them up in the microwave. No thanks.  We sent the tea back because it was tepid if you could even call it that. They finally brought out a pot of "hot" water with a tea bag (no loose tea). Hey, I carry tea bags in my purse. White rice was to come with both our entrees but we only got one order which was barely warm and then when we were packing our to go cartons, because who wants to eat cold food, they brought the other order which was hot, but we were leaving. Not the best recommendation. They need to up their game. I did see a lot of pick up orders so maybe that is their specialty. (You can then heat up the food at home).

TacGuPcNlQCYFVROZqLkwA.text: Keerati aka Ben was very friendly and the food was awesome. The house sauce was amazing

ces30MOsXodTA8UY0mlqjg.text: The first Thai restaurant in Henderson I feel is truly authentic. This place has a great menu and can rival anything in Chinatown.

wFUMUVPaZJGni37OwhLUGA.text: Only a week old and the word is out!  Food is delish!!!  Congrats and keep up the yummyliousness!!!

Vxp5keGA4Qp1tg1zlkStDw.text: It was good nothing to great but not bad. The menu had a good variety. The employees were nice and did a good job. The waitress got my order wrong but she was super busy so i just ate it anyway. The place is clean including the bathrooms and parking was easy. The chairs are uncomfortable.

a7Cn_I_8us2XsPiNO59ECg.text: Super delicious and fresh food. Extremely flavorful. The prices were fair and service was excellent. Don't miss the panang curry and drunken noodles for sure!

AOBICMJFapp3Wo4OR5f7Hw.text: After stopping for fuel nearby I decided to come here on a whim for lunch since it's near my house. The friendliness of the staff who greeted me were polite but lukewarm in enthusiasm. After being seated, they tended to my beverage order within seconds. The vegetable soup that came with my lunch entree arrived shortly after my drink. The plate from the soup was chipped and the broth of the soup was bland. The Pad kra paid (with chicken) was flavorful and balanced with heat-spice, but the chicken was dry. I was disappointed that the lunch special didn't offer a choice between brown rice or white. Overall, 3 stars. I may return to try another dish.
