b3Vdx7fCa1md3jXze7lh7Q.text: Best thai place hands down. Good thai coffee, yummy food, and you get a whole lot of it. It was super busy yet we got our food super quick.

H1Emroy5LSHBJ1IqGij2gA.text: Been going here since they opened. I enjoy the paradise salad as well as the beef jerky.  The employees take the time to talk to you and see how you are doing etc. I'm glad they look busy.

2MNIK3Gugkg3goOEMU084Q.text: The food is always delicious and the prices are reasonable but the last few times we have tried to order to-go they have turned their phones off and we have had to wait 20-30 minutes inside for our order rather than calling it in and picking it up. When we inquired about why the phone lines were disconnected, they just replied that they are busy. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IF YOU ARE ORDERING TO-GO. It is a major inconvenience!

7L81-P8p66z3IhO800VKiA.text: Yelp alerted me to this hot and new location, and when I saw they had Khao Soi, I placed an order immediately. They deliver too!! Came promptly, everything was fresh and delicious. This is such a game changer for our neighborhood!! Welcome to henderson!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. My chicken Khao Soi to-go!

jeK8fySbiGBsmGd7ysuOWA.text: EXCELLENT THAI FOOD AND DINING EXPERIENCE!   Seriously this is my new favorite restaurant hands down in Henderson. Stand out service and absolutely delicious cuisine.  I went on a Monday night for the first time and quickly returned the following Wednesday. It's Friday and I'm already set to meet a friend there early this upcoming week. IT WAS THAT GOOD YOU GUYS.   I would 100 percent recommend getting the tom kha (the one with coconut milk) soup under the vegan options. I was blown away at the flavor of this soup. It's the perfect combination of salty, sweet, and spicy. The veggies in this soup are hearty, and flavorful. Let's not forget about the incredible aroma of this soup. It's heaven.  After my first trying their soup, I could not stop thinking about it. My four year old even asked for it days later. (That says a lot!)   I returned for lunch two days later (they offer great lunch specials) to get a large order of the coconut milk soup and a lunch portion of yellow curry with shrimp. AGAIN- everything was phenomenal. I didn't want it to end. I would totally recommend the salad as a side because  their ginger dressing is tangy gingery perfection. It was seriously so tasty.  The restaurant is super clean. The service is excellent, the presentation is beautiful, and the staff is as friendly as they come. I love that they offer so many vegan options.   I am going to make it a point to eat here weekly. Honest to goodness my new favorite spot to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellow shrimp curry
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. AMAZING TOM KHA SOUP (pre coconut milk-oops)

IsExjPVVUKHHIYE02TyKQw.text: The best Thai food in Las Vegas-friendly servers too.  Love the beautiful and unusual drinks-so delicious and refreshing. I would love to have one in Mts. Edge.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

-MhtsK7KInjIGgvdkzvhKA.text: Just enjoyed their Salmon dish. I've been around the world more times than a space satellite...and eaten at the best of the best. This dish blew my socks off .No doubt about it ...this my new favorite restaurant...and this salmon dish has me hooked...great portion size to boot. Be sure to order their vegan chocolate cake....a killer dessert for only $5.00.

2TxZPx-_OkoFKGvVR4xeew.text: Thai coffeee was aaaaaammazing.  We had papaya salad, drunken noodles, and crispy duck Panang curry.  We ordered all the dishes at 4 spicy, and it wasn't unbearably spicy, the noodles were t very spicy and that helped break up the heat a little bit.  Service was a little slow, we sat for about 10 minutes before we placed orders. And it was kind of the same when we finished and wanted the bill.  Definitely the some of the best Thai food I've had in Henderson.

TW4swk5STqIf-PQKxo2j7Q.text: Service was slow, but the food and the friendliness of the staff made up for it! We came on a Saturday evening and waited for several minutes for a table to be cleaned.  We perused through the menu and ordered the following:  - Vegan corn cakes w/sweet and sour dipping sauce - actual corn mixed in the flour...not a huge fan as the corn kernels kept getting stuck on my teeth - chicken wings and sticky rice - rice was bluish, but my daughter loved it.  The wings were sweet and salty and the meat had a nice chew to it. - Pad See Ew Beef - not as pan fried as I would have liked, but still good. - Panang Pork Curry - the curry is not as thick as I would have liked either, but the flavor profile was there.  We wanted to order the crispy duck panang but they ran out.  We also ordered the thai iced tea and thai iced coffee, but they had to brew a new batch so we only got it half way through our meals...so that became dessert instead.  Overall, the food was better than I expected, and staff was great.  We will definitely come back to hopefully try the crispy duck panang and crabmeat fried rice.

HyamV33GXO1uCfyFhELO0A.text: I'm so happy to have a Thai restaurant with some vegan dedicated options! The menu is equally expansive for vegans as it is for omnivores, and almost everything seems to have a vegan equivalent. Even better is that the Thai iced tea comes vegan so there's no confusion about the creamer in it or concern that they might forget to sub it out. I crave Thai iced tea on a pretty regular basis, so having one that reminds me perfectly of my pre-vegan days (without compromising on my diet) is super exciting! I had their red curry, which was quite yummy, and my partner-- who isn't even vegan-- gave the khao soi a try (as the vegan version, since they had both), and he said it was really good too! The crispy rolls were pretty good, and the value is definitely worth it. I'm looking forward to trying some of their other dishes-- if anyone can pry me away from the curry.

ikgZLpISd0HUgc7ckbzepg.text: We ordered the papaya salad and the pad woon sen.  The interior is pretty nice. Clean. Nice decor. No weird food odors.   Papaya salad was bland. I said medium spicy and it was seriously a 0. Not even a hint of spicy. Not only was it not spicy but there was no taste. It was very bland.   Pad woon sen was also very bland. The beef is tough and rubbery. The noodles were not over cooked which is good but I believe I will not come here again.

86J1Gq9NFKwwGUBZqysvcw.text: Excellent service fast and very friendly. Food was Delicious good prices good portions tasty and Authentic.Very Clean Restaurant also.

_hir4WAjvbOL3vPSFmxPrQ.text: I'm very disappointed with the recent service I received. They say the third time is the charm... not in this case, I will not be going back.

w7U84wxvzrUipyRMo-mLag.text: LOVE this Thai place, so much flavor in every dish! The MooPing pork skewers are great but the pad Thai with chicken is beyond amazing and always crave-able. Keep it up guys you're awesome!

k0PXHXHfGI2J_FqiIo59Yw.text: Giving this place an A+!!! Phenomenal service, AMAZING prices, and incredible dishes! Such an awesome vegan menu! We ordered the Yellow Curry, Tofu Pad Thai, and crispy spring rolls. The Yellow Curry sauce was to die for! The pad thai and crispy rolls were also very tasty. This will be our go-to vegan Thai food resturaunt!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Tofu Pad Thai, Yellow Curry, &amp; Crispy Spring Rolls

d-LptbCPSpeaxgHr37QO_Q.text: This is a great place for vegans! There are three pages just for us   I've had each of the curries and was not disappointed.   They even have a special butterfly drink that changes colors. My girlfriend loves it.   It can get crowded, I suggest not sitting by the door. Lots of to go orders and you're closest to the counter.   I'm hoping they get a different fake "chicken". One thing I don't recommend here.

oC2vsHxYbPdEKa7bZE5tFQ.text: PROS:  1. Close to home and EOS gym 2. A brand new restaurant  3. Clean interior design  4. Great food, offers vegan entrees  5. Great customer service  6. Reasonable prices   CON: 1. Too close to home & the gym  Try it for yourself.

Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken pad thai. 4/5.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Corn kernel fried fritters. 3/5.

ExR2I5u5kuFKMe_0XTlk4A.text: What is unfortunate for this place? Is that the location it is in is a difficult shopping center to get to, and there is no real advertisement or signage going on for this place...that is all that is bad I can say about this spot!  Started going to this place recently, maybe the past month and I am happy I checked it out. I have been getting the pad thai with chicken #5 on the spice and a thai tea and I must say already several visits in i am ready to try another dish. Not because I am sick of the same dish (today for example my pad thai chicken was so good i cleared the plate) but because the other dishes I saw people enjoying looked excellent.  The food taste very fresh. I have only been going for lunch, price is $8 and you can't beat it with the portion they offer. Presentation is perfect also, served on a square plate, clean and neat. Perfect portions (today had a little bit extra I think but I am not complaining).  Must go to check out if you like Thai food and want something delicious. Don't waste your time going over to Teriyaki Madness (although that's isnt bad either) you know, why settle for eh when you can have whoa?

lkYmhjqMrGbA5Ci0r8trRA.text: Drake (non-vegan): My order was the tom yum seafood. I wish it had had a richer flavor like the tom yum I had in Thailand.   Ally (vegan): Since I came back from Thailand a few months ago, I hadn't eaten vegan khao soi here in Vegas, so I was really looking forward to trying this place. The portion was great, it came with rice and a huge bowl of the khao soi. However it lacked the authentic flavor I was hoping for. On a different day I got the vegan pad thai which was also disappointing - it was almost flavorless.   Heads-up: Call ahead before getting here because there was a 15-20 minute wait when we arrived. The restaurant is pretty small.

kZyOf-GJuZRP4Y10BS5jFQ.text: Thai VEGAN faux meat options!!! LOTS OF THEM!!! Yes they do! There are so great at the vegan pieces that non vegans have no idea it's vegan! I honestly checked With the waitress like three times... To make sure it was me. I'm sure she thought it was a total loon... Or hard of hearing! LOL  If your vegan.... or not vegan... check this place out.   Parking is super simple, seating is simple, food is simple, Check is simple..... this place is exactly what every place should be. Some vegan, some not, easy to accommodate everyone in your group!   This is my new favorite faux meat Thai place now! Way to go guys!   I Do you wanna warn you... This place is usually closed on Mondays which absolutely breaks my heart because this is the first place I want to come to you when I come into town each month!  No matter where you live... This is definitely a worthwhile place to come check out.

QlkEJEztRzFM_41PViqXdQ.text: I decided to try Thailicious based on previous Yelp reviews.  We entered at 6:30 pm on a Saturday, this place seems to have a revolving door for takeout orders. The inside was very slow with only three patrons seated when we arrived.  Thailicious has a great location (215 & Stephanie) located in a strip shopping area.  Unfortunately,  I found the service subpar, especially considering business was slow and three servers were "working the dining area".  We started with PLA GOONG (shrimp salad) which had very little lettuce and was served with a warm dressing, not my favorite.  My dinner  arrived 10 minutes after my daughters, no explanation or communication from our server!  The Pad Thai in my opinion doesn't have an authentic texture or flavor - leaving me with no reason to return or reheat my leftovers.

Etzjo5OIE2miOSLG5hka7Q.text: I love this place!! It's one of my go to places after a great workout. It's right next to my gym. And the spices in the food and fresh ingredients add to feeling refreshed and healthy after a good sweat at the gym. It's a modern atmosphere, and the staff works together for timely and efficient service. It's casual and comfortable! As far as the food, I've eaten here at least 10 times and I've never been disappointed. It's healthy, fresh and has many vegan options. I always get the paradise salad. Crisp tofu, shaved green apple, shredded carrots and a bit of crunch from the cashews! It has a hint of coconut and I had them to a 7 for spiciness. We tried the duck soup and the pad Thai with chicken. Both were fantastic! The duck soup had a rich broth, but not too heavy where it over powered the duck. The pad Thai was as to be expected from any Thai restaurant. The restaurant is always clean. If you're in the mood for healthy, tasty food. This is a hit! My husband and I ordered these three dishes, and brought plenty home for a solid lunch for the next day.

WNTt1H0S8SqhuBqCzZ5Aiw.text: I don't remember ever being charged for a lemonade refill. When I asked for a refill I was told I had to pay for it. I told him I'd pay for it, but I'll never be back. After awhile he brought the refill after I was done. I told him I don't want it. He said it was free. I still didn't want it. As we were leaving he said, "next time" I told him there'd be no next time. He began to explain to me the lemonade was handmade and that's why they charge a second glass. I had no idea. It was $3 for the first glass. I didn't inquire until I saw the bill. I would think this would be worth mentioning first thing. "Handmade Lemonade" $3 a glass. NO REFILLS!

hF1QAelso2r0ht_J6eCztg.text: I've been excited to try this place for a while now after hearing so many good things. It's also a very convenient location that I would visit often. Staff was friendly, and the atmosphere inside was inviting. I ordered massaman curry with chicken to go and the flavor was wonderful with good portions. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by undercooked potatoes and -- as you'll see from the pictures-- I got a little something extra with my meal about halfway in.  My wife and I both loooove Thai food, but I think we'll stick with our usual spot for now.

qyiy69bidpZ5w09cqcL21A.text: We are new to the area and trying out a bunch of Thai places. We came across Thailicious because we can see their sign in the freeway. We went here for dinner and we ordered a bunch of stuff to try.   My favorite dish is the duck pad kra pao! It's something unique and you don't see a lot of Thai places serve duck. The duck was so juicy and so good! It's a good portion for how much it was. Their pad Thai is also another favorite. Other places we've tried made their pad Thai really sweet but their pad Thai is more on the sour and spicy side. Their coconut soup is also pretty good. Love to eat Thai soup with rice  My husband loves their larb and he gets them with extra lettuce cup.   Definitely give them a try when you have a chance. They also have lunch specials during the weekday.

qeqjev_w2UapdPQgZ-8uGw.text: Stopped in for lunch, great service. Good food. I had the mixed vegetables lunch special. Very delicious. Spice level to the level expected it. Great lunch.

CGgV-JSaDhSS3pFflwTw5g.text: This place is so close to where I live! For some reason, I've only eaten here three times since it has opened. Believe me, it's not because the food isn't good. The food here is absolutely delicious! As a matter of fact, it's amongst the tastiest I've had in the Las Vegas Valley! The last time I ate here (yesterday), I ate every ounce of food on my plate and wanted more! Well okay, maybe that's because I cycled for two and a half hours up and down hills through the desert at a vigorous speed! Lol! But truly, it is delicious!!!   Okay, so let's talk about the atmosphere. It feels crowded. I don't want to be disrespectful, but the dining area is a big square room with tables and chairs. No booths. No privacy. No decor. And the chairs and benches are quite uncomfortable. The plaza is unoccupied, with many vacant storefronts. There's not a lot going on for some reason. It almost feels industrial.   On a positive note, the servers certainly make up for the lack of decor in the restaurant and the lack of activity in the plaza. The people here are sooo nice, and the service is excellent!   My final thoughts... take out would be ideal, since I live so close! I don't think they deliver, but I don't mind ordering delivery via Yelp!

Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Just thought I&#39;d try to get a shot of the seating. Lol!

1sCtePAFmxvg1dLzgCV0qg.text: I salivate at the thought of this place. Hands down, my favorite Thai food restaurant in Vegas. I absolutely love that they have several pages on their menu dedicated to strictly vegan food/drink options - bravo Thailicious!  Dishes I've Tried (all vegan, all 5/5!) + Red curry w/ brown rice  + Avocado green curry w/ brown rice  + Tofu pad Thai + Vegetable pad Thai  + Vegetable spring rolls   Pros + Yum + YUMM + YUMMY! + Cute Small intimate local place  + Friendly, fast service  + Affordable lunch specials M-F, 11am-3pm + Tastiest Thai food I've ever had  Cons - it's a cute small place, so during the week around dinner time it gets a little busy; therefore, there might be a wait. - Food is habit forming, sooo long skinny jeans (haha jk a lot of it is healthy!)  I challenge non-vegans to order a dish off of the vegan menu. You will be shocked and how flavorful it is. If you accept my challenge shoot me a message on here and let me know your thoughts!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan Red Curry
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan Avocado Green Curry - Holy WOW this is so incredibly tasty and addicting!

FEy8YIvdqlRyaRTZywnohg.text: It's not Thai-riffic, but I liked it.  Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan (note: I didn't do anything vegan here and don't plan to in the foreseeable future) is a very popular spot that has been serving Henderson for over a year. Located on the other side of the plaza from the EoS Fitness on Stephanie and constantly drawing my eye when I would see it from the highway, this restaurant finally enticed me to come in for dinner on a cold night after flying back in to town.  We actually had to wait a good 10-15 minutes to get seated (tip: sign the waiting list at the front desk), and once we did, it surprisingly took quite a while until we could order. Kinda funny considering that they checked on us about 4 times in quick succession after we got our food.  Overall, portions were great and everything was enjoyable, so I wouldn't give it just 3 stars. I could see myself taking a quick jaunt down the highway for a lunch special or stopping by to grab dinner. But I'm gonna nitpick to explain why this isn't anywhere near a 5-star review.  Khao Soi ($11.99): a curry noodle soup that gets even better when eaten with the sides of mustard greens, red onion, and lime (for squeezing). I'm glad that I ran into an old acquaintance (sup, Ivo) who recommended this to me.  Now the nitpicks: I was confused that the noodles were round instead of the flat noodles in other versions which I've enjoyed. I also could tell that the broth was basically the "coconut milk with curry powder" which the menu described, nothing more. Other khao soi broths are clearly more layered and flavorful.  Massaman Beef Curry ($9.99): a beef-only option. It's sweeter than other curries, and the peanuts are a fun difference. However, the potatoes were undercooked for my taste, perhaps because they were cut into such large chunks.  Red Curry with Chicken ($9.99): about as savory and flavorful as you'd typically expect from red curry, but I was surprised that I didn't get much heat when ordering a spicy level 3 out of 10. At one of my favorite Thai places, I'm accustomed to a low level of suffering from a red curry with a 3 out of 10.  Sticky Rice ($2.00): too dense and consequently too tough to cut. The blue color is just a dye gimmick. Not my personal choice for an order, and not planning to get this again ever.  I'll definitely try some of the more typical noodle dishes and consider some of the soups and apps. Thailicious is at least Thai-lerable, but it's far from Thai-mazing.

Ffg-TWr5SM5aC6l1d4XyXg.text: GET THE CALAMARI.  That's the only tip you need.  You will thank me later.  I order calamari if it's on any menu and this was THE BEST calamari I have ever had.  Fried perfectly, crisp, and tender but the secret is the seasoning and the green onions and cilantro on top.  I don't know what seasonings they use but oh my gosh.  My taste buds are salivating as I'm writing.    We also ordered soft shell crab, beef broccoli, papaya salad, bbq chicken, beef satay, chicken satay and a few other things.  Everything was on point but I'm going back just for calamari and fried rice.

qxmBe6xZhrr2_ikHn1v5yg.text: I can't believe it took me this long to try Thailicious out! I may never leave now!   First impressions: My family came in to try Thailicious for lunch after church one afternoon. Right when they opened at noon, a whole swarm of us came into the joint. I saw so many locals and regulars come in and immediately felt like this was a cool neighborhood small business. We decided to order a few things to share and then other items when we came back again.   Food: We started with the crispy spinach, vegan crispy rolls, and steamed dumplings. My little one crushed everything aka ate it all up without even blinking. The spinach was the fun welcome surprise we hadn't tried before. I ordered the tofu pad see ew (thick noodles with brown sauce and broccoli) and my husband did the tofu pad Thai while my little one had veggie fried rice (extra peas of course.) ... we barely had leftovers to bring home!   Service: Our water glass never went empty and everyone who worked there checked in on us regularly. We even chummed it up with others near our table as we all watched some Sunday afternoon football.   I'm pumped we now have another vegan-friendly restaurant to support!   Next on the list to try: papaya salad and fresh rolls!

jr8GMZXGJg93mobz6TO7qg.text: Ordered some items to go. Food was decently good, spice was way off. Portions were just ok.   Pad see ewe beef 9/10 Pad kra pow chicken 8/10 Yellow curry chicken 7/10  The spiciest of the three was the curry but the spice was equivalent to a mild-medium at most Thai places. I wish they had a smaller scale because 1-10 is too large of a scale to decide with. Or a normal mild-medium-hot scale would be even easier. When I asked the worker over the phone how spicy are their levels, she replied "I don't know the answer to that."   Would we come again? Probably not because it wasn't super impressive.

bY1RzyQ8FV6EWlzNge6_JA.text: I'm a Thai-addict and eat vegan most days of the week, so thought this would be the perfect place to try.  I came in for lunch time specials, which are only $6.99. This is a pretty great deal especially when I'm used to CA prices. Their vegan menu is pretty extensive which I appreciate. But at the same time, most Thai food can be made vegan even if it's not explicitly stated.  My order was the green curry. It came with a cup of soup (or salad) and egg roll. The soup was a nice and simple veggie soup that I enjoyed. The egg roll was kind of bland and I didn't care for it much. The curry was decent. I really liked the fried tofu in it. But I feel it lacked in variety of veggies. And most importantly it lacked in SPICE. I got a level 9 and I didn't feel a thing. It seemed a bit watered down than your usual creamy and flavorful Thai curries. Plus the portion is pretty small (but that's expected with the cheap lunch price).   I would've given this place a 4, but the servers were RUDE. They took forever to seat me, even though I was alone and there were many tables open. They didn't really try to be hospitable/friendly during my meal either. When I was clearly done with my food, I waited over 15 min for a check.. Even though they sat me literally right in front of where they were standing the whole time. So eventually I just had to call them over.  Maybe they didn't care to give me good service since I'm just a solo person coming in for lunch, so I wouldn't be spending much. But you would think they'd try harder to get a repeat customer. Nope, not me, sorry.

QwfDaG5BByX2cl2UfQhsGg.text: Great lunch prices and simple menu! Portions were excellent. Service was a bit slow but it was crowded for lunch. Food was tasty and fresh. However the food was average and nothing extraordinary. But the value and portions for lunch were one of the best in the area.

RMViUB7HtlCsHfpgfFRMTg.text: I had a long day at work and I was craving for Thai food. So I thought I would go to Thai Express but turns out I guess they are shut down. I started to yelp for Thai food and found the next nearest location which was Thailicious just further down the street of S. Stephanie st.   First walked in, it was a very quaint and modest. Against the wall would be a mural of a  Thai temple I am assuming. Light fixtures were cute and added texture to the overall layout of the restaurant.  I told the girl at the hostess desk that it was my first time and I wanted to to take out.   As I sat down waiting for my food to come out, Dutch, the owner and ask me if I wanted anything to drink hot  or cold. The I asked for Hot Tea and he came out with a glass mug and served me jasmine Green tea. I thought," O Wow!" Very thoughtful. He represented his restaurant very well which tells me he cares about his business.  When 7:00 pm came around it was getting packed. And I notice he has regulars that came back because he would say welcome back.   I ordered the Crispy Duck Panang, spicy level 4. Kra Pao Fried rice, spicy level 3 ad Vegan Papaya salad, spicy level 2. When I got home and Everything that I had was amazing. It hit the spot for me. I would definitely come back here again and dine in. Great Hidden Gem!

c4-J4oZRqo2KOUIFclYv3g.text: Best Thai food in Henderson.  Pineapple fried rice, eggplant basil chicken and shrimp Pad Thai were all delicious. Nice clean place too.

IUjkLp80xng9fUkekhbFUw.text: This place is so good! Went here on a Saturday night and it was pretty busy along with people coming in & out for take out orders. They ask you on a scale from 1-10 how spicy you want your food. We got a 4. If you're a whimp when it comes to spicy food (like me!!!) you might want to go a little lower because they like their spice! We ordered the papaya salad, pad thai, and red curry and all were delicious & the portions are huge! We will definitely be back! Inside the restaurant, seating is a little bit limited but it's clean and tastefully decorated. I definitely recommend!

13f_6mwknxQU8JqJmgoznQ.text: We have known the owner for years.  Great guy.  He and his wife have worked at Komol Kitchen with family & now have their own place.  Authentic and awesome.

WwiFOMcybfH_mKJRjJBDPg.text: Amazing food. Their lunch specials are good. Try the level 10 spicy for a great taste bud tickle.

aaqzR1tcLB8ofwCn9dijBw.text: My goal is to try everything here. Unfortunately when I try something new it becomes my favorite. I really appreciate the efforts of the cooks and staff to make their restaurant a #1...seafood dishes are always my favorite...

6_VT14r559Y2Dr8WSX7qjA.text: There are many Thai restaurants to choose from in the valley but we love this one best. The service is good and the staff is friendly. The menu has a great selection without being overwhelming. The prices are reasonable and portions just right. The vegetarian and vegan options are amazing. It's great to have a Thai place that offers more than just tofu options to its regular menu.  The soups are my favorite--full of veggies. The veggie spring rolls are delicious. The meat options are tasty too. You can add heat to any dish in reasonable increments.

CycfU37W_LXAeAR0A0tSqA.text: So so good! Finally a place that has both vegan and non vegan options. Everything they use is super fresh and the prices are so low and reasonable. Definitely new fav Thai spot. The owner as well is a really nice guy, you can tell he works hard to make sure everything is going well. Would 100% recommend! Everyone should try the soups for sure.

u7iIPoq99Imsd8yqHfmPig.text: Absolutely delicious food. Great atmosphere. Good service. The location is a little difficult to get to but certainly worth it.

9LrVIZhSNKagqA2Z2ovKYg.text: Oh my goodness, this was the BEST Thai food I've EVER had!!!!! We tried the Thai beef jerky for appetizer and it was incredibly delicious. Then we ordered the Panang  chicken curry and drunken noodle chicken dish and finished it all. If there weren't other people there we seriously would have licked the plates, lol! This place is going to be a big hit!

w4hbvz2b2Y3C0M4p4kLyzA.text: The best thai food ever. We were on our way back from vegas, best vegetarian options and food as well. We were on our way from Hoover dam stopped by for lunch friendly service and also awesome food highly recommend thus place if you are vegetarian and love Thai food.

ElgOikeucZUhe2IQ4y2DEA.text: I keep finding my self coming back to this place. By far the best pad Thai I've had in Vegas. Food is always top notch with fresh ingredients.

-6AG3w2eD4OY6l8los2T8A.text: So with all the incredible reviews, I had to go try this restaurant. Unfortunately, Thailicious was only Thaiokayish for me today. First, walking into the restaurant, the setting seemed very wrong to me, A table right by the front door and the front desk set back from it, so everyone entering is literally passing right next to your table, never mind passing it, they wait right next to you to be seated. Okay, perhaps trivial. Tables are set so close to one another you cant have a private conversion with your date. We were brought water right away, good start, orders taken promptly thereafter. Wife ordered Pad Thai with tofu, I ordered eggplant with chicken. But I also ordered the crispy spinach appetizer. So my wife's plate shows up around 10 minutes later and she is waiting for mine before she starts. I encourage her to enjoy it while its still hot, she noticed it didn't come with crushed peanuts as its suppose to. Another 5 minutes pass by before she could ask for them. My meal finally arrives. So for flavor of food I'll give it 4 stars but service is low 3. So now we have our meals and half way through them, my appetizer shows up. Personally, I should have said take it back. Appetizer is pre meal. The crispy spinach taste good but it was extremely oily. I understand this restaurant is new but prioritizing things shouldn't be so difficult. I'm willing to try it again and see if things get better. Overall, Id say the food is pretty good.

R-409xwQws9w1H4TBPaZ2Q.text: Stopped in with my wife tonight for first time based on Yelp reviews.  Glad We did!  Great food, great service, reasonable prices.  I will be back.

Lj6xR0pOX8hS9rb-MRgB0A.text: Delicious vegan options, was not disappointed. Came back twice on Grand opening day. So good! Great service, owner was super friendly. Lovely atmosphere to go with great food!

Paxg-IvilddJ1n6pCMXxOQ.text: Just opened today! Was seated and served free Thai tea even though we ordered takeout. Awesome customer service and well prepared for opening day  thank you to Dutch!

Jy55bDraypo0e9-Roksrcg.text: My favorite thai joint in town! Beats every other place in terms of quality for price-point. V15VGkmkkhvF0hEfPVoQQQ.text: Amazing food and friendly staff. I've never had a bad meal. _uoaN58lsFsQXcteLgNTUg.text: I'm Thai by blood, so when a restaurant advertises that they are authentic, I would know what that really means.  I'm pleased to report that almost everything we ordered was indeed not only authentic but also delicious!  The only reasons they lose a star are: 1) The Pad Seeuw had regular broccoli in it.  Chinese broccoli would've been truly authentic and tasted better.  Perhaps I could've requested it, I don't know, but I shouldn't have to.  2) The seats are uncomfortable.  They were all either wooden bench-like seating or metal chairs, all without cushions.

c-2tNOLivAF2LacV6aG_nQ.text: Food and service was amazing. My water was never be empty and the serving size was perfect. Presentation is great and atmosphere is nice. Little small but the customer service is on point because of the size.

YGAfpC7-eFeUDjNrXXoPnA.text: I ordered take out for me and my sister. I had the vegan pineapple rice - delicious!  She had the drunken noodles. We both got them at the 8 spicy level. The spice was on point. Her noodles were a little dry, but other than that dinner was great.

AzfmNp294F07qWqi1nIfSA.text: Great food, great service. The restaurant is impeccable and the staff is incredible kind. Get the crab/cream cheese wantons, they are to die for.

OAx4gBCg4UmO885vBnULww.text: Great tasting food but I am regularly disappointed with the lack of chopping or cutting. I dont care for stew sized veggies in my curry. Its just not enjoyable. Ive requested them chopping things up instead of giving me huge chunks and well sometimes they honor it and sometimes I get home to find lumberjack sized veggies in the curry. I will say this tho...the people are friendly and the papaya salad is the best I've ever had.

47WruFvlNFi17eLoNcNefQ.text: Happiest vegan customer ever!!!! I am the biggest advocate for this place! My boyfriend and I are here at least once a week. We love the food and all the vegan options. I ALWAYS start with the soy Thai beef jerky (tip: extra yummy dipped in peanut sauce) and for my main dish I get the tofu masaman curry. Never disappoints!! We love the staff as they are always super friendly and accommodating. Our orders are accurate every time, whether we dine in or do takeout. Love this place!!!

xYAfNLHNaJfZ63pAXPWMjg.text: A great and fantastic addition to the growing Thai food choices in the valley. This one may be one of the best in the Henderson area:  1. Location - In a strip mall right off the 215 and Stephanie in Henderson, it is convenient and easy to find.  2. Ambiance - Really liked the interior design of the place, Simple, but well done, plenty of seating options and a great and friendly staff.  3.  Service - Top notch. You will never run out of ice water here for sure.  And you can tell that they have great teamwork here because they all help each other and when your food is ready, you can be served by any of the team.  I like that as your food comes out hot.  4.  Wait time - We came at a 4:30 on Saturday and there were already several people dining and others waiting for take out.  By about 5:15, the place was getting pretty packed. I am gonna think that this place is pretty darn busy.  5.  The food -  Loved it.  The vegan choices here are fantastic and there are about 4 pages of vegan choices on the menu.  Paradise Salad - With green apples. nice and refreshing.  Eggplant and Basel with ground pork - a fantastic dish, great presentation and taste. As you know, I really enjoy this dish with ground meat, as it picks up the flavor more than sliced meats.  Tom Yum Soup with Chicken - Great tasting with mushrooms and tomatoes. Not the best in the world, but definitely good.  Masaman Curry with Beef -  We always get the yellow curry and sometimes the Masaman curry. The wife tends to like the yellow curry due to thicker and sweet with the coconut milk.  The Masaman is less spicy and has more of that Indian type of flavor  Avocado Green Curry (Vegan) - This was recommend by our waitress, who used to work at Thai Room on Tropicana and Pecos, which is by my office and I see here there.  This was something that was interesting with the avocado, and all the veggies. Overall very nice dish.  The pricing was great, service wonderful, ambiance was perfect.  A great quick meal and we enjoyed it thoroughly.  We will be back for sure!

9Ru2K7BHIL6lJ0id4ZKyEQ.text: Wrong turn and ended up here...very fortunate  Supperb taste and great service.   Tried drunken noodles, pad ki sew, and some deep fried fish cake. Ohh wow!!!

cSjru9c9ByaNT3gjlNMHng.text: THAILICIOUS was amazing! I came with a bunch of friends and it's vegan and vegetarian friendly! Super cute and modern ambiance.  I tried the Butterfly pea lemongrass juice is refreshing . Almost like a fruity pebbles but like a juice. The lemongrass hint tasted amazing! The lemon changes the color of the juice from blue to purple and makes it tastes sweeter & fruitier! Then ordered a shrimp pad Thai which wasn't too spicy from a scale from 1-10. I ordered a 2 since I'm sensitive on spice. I ended up adding a little chili sauce to spice it up more. I also tried the Tom Yum was good but needed more lime and spices and after 3 limes, it tasted better. I also tried the Fried Eggplant with sweet & sour sauce, it was amazing! The fried Tofu with brown sugar peanut sauce is also great too!  Jaida was kind enough to even bring a dessert for the birthday celebrant which looked amazing and it was!

qdOJN3Jl43fuD6jUn9pu5Q.text: Went here because of the reviews and was extremely underwhelmed.  When we arrived there was a wait to get a table which is usually a good sign and we were more than happy to wait the less than 10 minutes to get a table.  Once we sat is when I started to get worried about how the night was going to go.  I watched one of the servers clearing a table by sticking his fingers inside the previous tables glassware and take them to the bus tub which was on a cart in view of the dining room.  He then walked to our table with a pad of paper to take our order without washing his hands.  Not following guidelines set by the health district became a common theme for the rest of the short period we were there.  Another server ringing an order in walked away from the computer towards the kitchen openly coughing and not even attempting to cover his mouth.  The server trying to take our food order never welcomed us, just walked up to the table and said "ready to order", I don't understand why formalities are skipped in some restaurants.  So I just ordered a Thai iced tea which I watched him make thru the server entrance of the kitchen and still no washing of hands but he did continuously wipe his hands on his pants.  He also brought lemons which my guest asked for and I said he shouldn't use unless he wanted whatever cold virus the previous table might of had from the glassware that the server stuck his fingers in.  Before the server comes back with our Thai iced tea and lemons another servers walks over and says ready to order and is very annoyed when we ask a few questions.  We asked her opinion and she would shrug her shoulders and say she had no idea, with this we knew we would have to guide our own way thru their large menu.  We ordered crispy eggplant then asked some other questions about other starters and again felt as tho we were taking to long and annoying her.  We ordered the rest quickly, she never asked spicy level but I stated again which we wanted first and then the entrees after the starters.   Within in minutes the server that had yet to wash his hands while continuing to bus tables and deliver food, delivered the crispy eggplant which lacked salt, barely any sauce and there wasn't anything crispy about them.  The staff also called them eggplant chips when dropped off so not sure if there was a different option on the menu that our server sent or not.  Half way thru our "chips" the hot pot of Tom kha soup arrived which she set the pot down and the stacked soup cups and spoons down, lit the hot pot and walked off.  She didn't say a thing, there was no "give this a minute until it's nice and hot" or "I'll be back to ladle some out for you".  I suggested to my guest that we wait a minute for it to start bubbling or at least steam coming from it.  Our server then delivered our entrees and I said that was too fast, we hadn't even finished our "chips", she said yeah there was a large party so the kitchen needed to get the food out.  First of all there was only 4 people of this large party that had arrived at this point so they hadn't even ordered and second why does my dining experience have to change due to a partially arrived large party that had yet to order.    At this point we were going to just quickly eat and leave and check it off as a place to never dine at again.  The two dishes we order, red curry and drunken noodles, were ok so it shows me that the food is the saving grace of the dirty handed service staff that is severely lacking.  Our burning hot pot of soup however was warm at best and the vegetables were raw so I flagged the manager over and told him.  He said sorry and said he would take it off our bill, never suggested to send a hot one nor did he ask how everything was.  No one asked how anything was and we even had our plates taken away when they still had some food on it by the server that had yet to wash his hands.  We were over it and just went to the register to pay and when asking for receipt were given the wrong receipt.  On that receipt we noticed how those guests were offered different levels of spice.  On the way back home which is on the other side of town my guest said to me "what a waste of time that was" and that's why I am spending my time writing this review.

OG0QrFLkUziyWkCeC_zPww.text: Wonderful for lunch.  Thailicious is delicious and affordable for lunch.  Highly recommend it!

LSQW_FwA3GZgZIDvO7sjww.text: I have been here three times now, and it was close amazing every time! I've had the Tom Kha Ka, the Beef Pad Se Ew, the Chicken Yellow Curry, the Thailicious Fried Rice, and the Drunken Seafood Spaghetti.  Of all those items, the only thing I wouldn't order again is the Spaghetti.  The sauce seemed too thick and made the noodles feel sticky.  Other than that, the rest of the food is awesome! My bf loves their fried rice! The place is typically busy and their dining room is pretty small, so you can almost always expect to wait. Other than one girl, who seemed like she really didn't want to be at work, everyone is pretty nice.  At one point, I wanted to try the mango sticky rice (it's one of my favorite thai desserts and I try it at every thai restaurant I go to), and our server was nice enough to let me know that their mangos were on the tart side and he didn't want me to be disappointed.  I really appreciated him giving me the heads up!  I will definitely try it the next time I go in though.

beIJzCiNCoPBmuRlWWReCA.text: Nice atmosphere, people are very friendly and welcome. Foods was good. If you are vegan, I would recommended this place. Lunch special is very inexpensive. Family and kids friendly.

VOHJx3DQYNJALkw8WRNHag.text: We've lived in the Henderson area for the past 7 years. We have finally found a delicious Thai restaurant with bonus vegan options! We love Thai food but have had a hard time finding a place that we want to return too. Thailicious is it! It's a small place with not a lot of tables, but we didn't mind the wait. It was also Friday night. We kept it simple with the traditional Pad Thai and beef Panang. The vegan in our group got the yellow curry and also the Veggie Crisp Rolls. I had the Tom Kha Kung soup, which is my absolute favorite. The youngest enjoyed sweet and sour pork which I was pleasantly pleased with because the batter was light and crispy and not greasy. The sauce was also light and fresh and not too sweet. Next time we will be more adventurous with our ordering. The staff was attentive and very friendly as well. Thanks for opening so close to home!

IZj_pDocjTqJQU-6_3Q-BQ.text: Food was delicious!!!  The crab fried rice was full of crab.  The pad Thai was awesome and the Panang Curry was amazingly delicious. They were so busy when I got my food!

fQjgKSw7dbr3iU0WEBgSFQ.text: Went in on a Friday evening at it was packed! -good sign!  We live close by so rather than waiting we just ordered it to go, went home, and came back to pick it up when it was ready.  The space itself is small and cozy, there's only seating for 2 if there is any kind of waiting going on. Also, I found the lighting to be too bright for the time of day. It didn't feel like dinner service ambiance, it felt like they were trying to illuminate the room like a cafeteria would be.  All in all, the food was excellent! One slight miscue with a special request of a tofu pad Thai dish, but still very enjoyable and some of the better Thai food I've has in town!

7XtugT4reD5JcwT7bZMXig.text: The food is decent. I like the vegan options.  But, I just had so much higher hopes.  I ordered for pickup the first time. I was very excited to discover vegan desserts when I arrived to pickup my food and promptly ordered the vegan chocolate cheesecake ($5). It was good, a standard vegan chocolate cheesecake that they added fresh fruit on top. I was dismayed to discover a moldy berry, but hoped it was an uncommon error.  The second time, I brought my mom and we ate in the restaurant. I ordered the lunch special pad see-ew with the hot cucumber soup. The soup was amazing. The pad see-ew was not. My mom ordered the lunch special sweet and sour pork with salad. The sweet and sour pork was amazing. The lettuce was standard from a bag. The ginger salad dressing was delicious.   I couldn't wait to order dessert again and gushed to my mom about their vegan desserts. However, the wait staff left me so annoyed that I skipped dessert. Our plates were done and on the side of the table for quite some time. I finally wondered what was up and looked around to see that all 4 waitstaff were talking and looking at their cell phones behind the podium. This went on for several more minutes until our waitress finally put her phone away and noticed I was staring at her.   She lost the usual 20% tip, instead getting about 17% and lost a larger bill because of no dessert.   With the abundance of Thai restaurants nearby, I do not plan on returning. I can also get a whole vegan chocolate cheesecake from Whole Foods and add my own berries (sans mold).

flYOkaTLddmrnJ_0cV3AnA.text: This is the best Thai restaurant in Nevada. I come here once a week because I cannot escape the deliciousness that is their crispy duck panang curry. The service is always wonderful as I'm greeted with a genuine smile whenever I come in. Cannot recommend it enough.

p0neDRa69becGeCuV_yAXA.text: This place was super tasty. The owner is the nephew of the owner of Komol's, my other favorite Thai spot! And he recognized me. It was sweet! They had some great veggie options, but could use a few more.

The service was friendly and attentive. The best part was how delicious everything tasted!!!! The entrees we ordered (drunken noodles and cashew nut) were not spicy. If you prefer your dish on the spicer side, I would recommend asking the server if the kitchen can increase the spice level. Overall, highly recommend!

Et12q8LYwb9kquZJb-qAiw.text: Just visited Thailicious on its grand opening day and it was so nice to see how well prepared they were! We arrived around 6:00 and were seated immediately. Tables were quickly starting to fill up but we were glad to see that our order was brought out promptly. The restaurant is clean and spacious; their staff attentive, and the food is delicious! We ordered some pad thai, veggie fried rice, and yellow curry--all of which were comforting and flavorful. I did notice that they don't ask for a spice level for any of their dishes. Personally, I do not mind this at all and actually prefer they determine that themselves, but just a heads up for those of you who are used to that at other Thai restaurants. Thailicious also has an extensive plant-based/vegan menu apart from the regular menu, so there was something for everyone. I am definitely bringing my whole family next time!

LSpzpzO5diJQmm8hE_thfg.text: As an omnivore, I wouldn't rave about this place for Thai cusines. The service was nice but very typical of Thai restaurants in the states, serving dishes that are too sweet or too salty. We ordered a number of dishes which included Thailicious Fried Rice, Cold Noodles with Veggies, Coconut Soup with Shrimp, Orange Chicken, & Curry. Skip the Orange Chicken because its very hard and coated with too much batter. The Shrimp was great; large in size, devained and flavorful yet the soup broth was too sweet.  The cold noodles was a nice healthy choice with fresh greens. Fried rice & Curry were the best choices yet I will not order chicken here or beef as its dry and tough to chew. I do get how vegetarians and vegans give this place a 4 to 5 star rating due to its many option choices for non meat eaters. The vegetables are fresh and flavorful and the menu has a couple of pages for vegan options. Overall, this isn't a 4 star restaurant yet we all have different taste when it comes to SE Cuisines.

A8pMzYrJzcXdQKu3XfZWQA.text: Great fresh Thai food. Lunch specials are top of the line flavor and price point. I would recommend for frequently.

cnU2URfvq3C7_9lIQ6J5Gw.text: The food here is delicious. If you haven't been yet, look no further this is your new go-to restaurant.

OmmJ_7aTGsCxjvUkmHpdsw.text: Are here twice during a stay in vegas, omfg so good. I recommend the seafood or combo with your choice of either pad thai or pan see EU noodles. They stuffed our plates with a good variety of meats. I ordered medium spicy fir flavor, I wish they had this back home in sd

W4ZHfrMOSKx3lRpSCfcDJA.text: I had the crab fried rice and it was really good it wasn't heavy and it tasted light and clean and tasty. The eggrolls were lukewarm and not very good. I had the scallop green curry and they were baby scallops. Which was completely unexpected and if you know anything about baby scallops - they're not tasty. You could've got away with three or four big scallops and the sauce and it would've been divine. The sauce/Curry is good and the heat was good as well. My husband got the Kung Pow and it was really small portion. Mostly onion very little bell pepper. Would never order that again.   I would come again to try something else. The noodle dishes are larger portions.

9YWYx3d-FxprzpqtyI82fw.text: Looking for vegan restaurants around me and Thailicious came up.  The environment was calm and the service was very amazing.   But what I need to rave the most about is how big a variety they had for vegan food!!  I tried the garden vegetable tofu.   It was made perfectly.  It wasn't salty at all and had a wonderful array of vegetables with it!   I will definitely be going back to try more plus it's only 1 mile away from my work!   Great lunch spot!

2Q5LkjKIyR33QfZKJ6XYcw.text: I ate here because my neighbor recommended this place & said it was one of the best Thai restaurants they've been to. I honestly thought the food was average. Everyone in my party had a stomach ache after eating here.   I guess my neighbor haven't been to many Thai restaurants to compare.

oDsXaXJe2NZ6tO-L4muCiA.text: Discovered this gem on our way back to the Strip after a trip to Hoover Dam. I'm afraid it may have ruined our favorite hometown Thai restaurant. The flavor was rich and ingredients fresh. Nice touches with orchids presented on the plates. We enjoyed won tons, Pad Thai, and Pad Se Eew. Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States

N2iWv83eFVVFrqA1mw2NXw.text: Ohhhh myyyyy! Can't acuse them of False advertising... this is truly Thailicious! Our family is vegan and we ordered a dish apiece from their vegan menu, then shared it family style. We couldn't decide which we liked the best, each bite was a delicious delight!  This was worth the flight to Vegas!  I'd take a picture but the plates are all empty!

cdCpJPjIDxppTQ_8oVd9EA.text: This place is nice, but.... how authentic I'm not sure. But what do I know I just love Thai food. Service is great and location is good too. Maybe it was just that day but when I ask for a six ( on how hot I want my chow ) wooooohooo ! It was really hot ! Like it was a 10. I didn't want to return it. Because my server was awesome. I can come back here if have to it's only a block from where I live. :)

GPhXAvFpijn_7SEWTzorQQ.text: Good thai restaurant for lunch in Henderson area. Their lunch specials, being only $6.99, are such good deals. Most thai restaurants in town charge $9-10 for lunch specials nowadays. You get a soup or salad and an egg roll with your lunch special. I tried their beef pad see ew. Nothing amazing, but it tasted good. Portion was generous as well. Worth to give this place a try if you happen to be in the area, but I wouldn't drive across town just for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch special - beef pad see ew

WrTdSFV5Y2_XJdq1vIMfqg.text: Welcome brand new thai place in Henderson that is absolutely thai-licious!   Babe loves taking me to new places and since we found out about this place we've already been three times. And they haven't been open long, so that's definitely saying something. I've called for pick up, dined in after a gym session, and came for lunch. They have awesome service (super friendly, always make sure you're okay and your drinks are filled), a great interior (super clean, ikea furniture, awesome floors and walls), and even better food (tasty, authentic, delicious)! The portions are big for what you pay and the food tastes really good.   We've had the pad thai, tom ka, and thailicious fried rice. All of which are super yummy! The thai tea is also pretty good if you wanna try it. If you're in the area or wanting to taste some flavorful thai food, stop by! I know you'll love it!   Thanks for always fulfilling my thai cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Soup
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken lunch special (HUGE PIECES OF CHICKEN BTW SO WORTH IT)
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Salad peanut dressing

Wape9POUzp7nMfgsc-_lDw.text: I was very excited to learn that there was another vegan friendly restaurant in Henderson.   We came in on a Saturday night and they were pretty busy but we only waited about 20 mins for a table which wasn't bad.   The wait staff was apologetic about the wait and very attentive. I ordered the vegan papaya salad and vegan Mongolian tofu. Both dishes were amazing. I loved the freshness of the papaya salad, the crispness of the green beans and cabbage. I loved the Mongolian sauce.   Place seems to be gaining popularity. Every table was full and there was a steady flow of take out customers.   I will definitely be back to try other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Fresh vegetable and tofu roll.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Dessert Menu

qvHztQ2tJr3sfQWFPjuxCA.text: Just another average Thai Americanized restaurant. Servings are small and rather plain and the price is sort of high for that level of quality. It's quite the oxymoron that it has 'Authentic' in its name.

Xk0d7k0Cmb3B-NZAM6nnUg.text: We came here in a Wednesday night and it was filled with people so we knew the place had to be good :) we order spring rolls and they were delicious . They were nicely fried and the filling was a little sweet. It was amazing ! The sauce is good too. Then we got our entrees. Two of us got pad Thai. They ask you what kinda spice level you want from 1-10 (10 being lost spicy). I got a level 3 and I thought it had a little kick to it . My friend got level 7 and she couldn't eat it! The manager at the restaurant offered to remake it for her but she declined . He ended up taking if off our bill which was super nice since she didn't eat much of it. My husband had a seafood hot and sour soup. He said it was amazing ! He thought it was a little spicy and he likes spice and hot . He ordered a medium . The server also gave us a sample of their pea blackberry tea which was delicious! We will definitely be back soon :)

0AAZzX96N79u83SngT1fjg.text: I live near by and love the flavors of their food. Portions are small for the price, but I keep going back because it taste good.   Panang Curry is good, pad si ew is a favorite and I love their Tom yum soup. I would give them 5 Stars if their spice rating was consistent. I ordered a 3 in the soup and it beyond spicy.       :(  that's not the only time it's happened. I order out a lot. I've started ordering nearly no heat and adding the spice when I get home.

Cvyb6Jzm71H_ipHKKPVw_w.text: Came here at peak lunch hour on a weekday. It was busy but not completely full - there were some unoccupied tables in the middle but yet there were still people waiting by the door to be seated. There were only two people working the front serving, bussing and seating people which I felt was not enough. They really need some extra help during lunch rush.  On to the food - the tofu skewer appetizer was good, but a little on the pricey side for 5 pieces of tofu. It was perfectly lightly fried, came with some dipping sauce (peanut based I think) and a mini cucumber salad.  Green curry with scallops - your typical curry but had scallops and eggplant in it. I was surprised to see this as an option because I usually don't see it on other Thai menus.  Crab fried rice - delicious. I always want to order this at every Thai restaurant. Very savory, hit the spot for me.  I'd come here again but try to avoid the lunch rush or at least get my food to go. Nice to see a Thai restaurant on this side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Tofu satay
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Green curry with scallops

VoapOKCjDjqyfgb0RtgOFA.text: I am obsessed w/red curry chicken so I always look for the best of the best restaurants; this location is remarkable and it does taste authentic to me. What can I say? My review is strictly for the food...I would return.

hI79fC14GL3tDXeXAwBgqA.text: This establishment is absolutely great. The food is delicious and the flavorful way that the food is made is rich and decadent. The place is very clean and well kept. It's simple and yet enticing.  Dutch, the gentleman who owns the place was there to personally take care of us and he did a great job with the impression that he gave us with his place.  We came here today based on Yelp reviews and after frustrating visit at Whole Foods. It was a switch worth made by us.  We will definitely visit again and try the other dishes on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Pad seew with Chicken.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Papaya Salad.
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Crispy Spinach based on popular Yelp reviews. Very good.

8-aBD9LBftrjTAblEUmc-Q.text: We recently moved to Henderson and love Thai food.  This restaurant came up on a search as near where we live.  I placed an order to go because we didn't have the time to eat in at the restaurant.  I ordered the house wings and sticky rice for my son, the panang curry for myself, and the green curry for my husband.  Our son absolutely loved the house wings and discovered he loves sticky rice (it was colored blue, which is a nifty way to distinguish sticky rice from steamed rice!)  The sweet and sour sauce that came with the wings was so fresh and tasted so good!  The two curries were exactly what we love!  They were so fresh, authentic, the perfect level of spice (medium) with amazing flavor!!  I am so happy with Thailicious and will definitely be a repeat customer and look forward to trying more dishes!!  I look forward to the next time eating in the restaurant!  It looked really nice when I picked up our food.

j_AzkgtttFy1kT4AKKJyUQ.text: This place has very authentic and clean Thai... plus vegan options!!!! The service was great and you tell the place is always clean and they use superior oils than some places.

dI8C1p7s3OUsjcmbbnWjfw.text: This is our favorite Thai place in Vegas (and yes we've been to many - and many of them are very well known!!) love their salad options! Paradise and Nam Sod khao Thod are DIVINE! Drunken noodles & rad na are also favs!!  Prices are right too

e-PveeknFk5oDu6TCEnyVw.text: Amazing food. Great, friendly and fast service. Must try the vegan Thai beef jerky and curry fried rice . The flavors are amazing.   I'm not even vegan, but I only eat off their vegan menu because it's sooo damn good. I love this place.

-4VdMWDrSm81Ch58QIQ03A.text: Fantastic cuisine.  I'm not a vegan but really like their vegan selections.   When I offer lunch to my staff, I ask do they want pizza, sandwiches, chick-fil-a, or Thailicious and they always vote for Thailicious.     I especially like the green curry avocado, and my super favorite the papaya salad with shrimp spice level 7.   The restaurant is super clean, front, back , kitchen, and bathrooms.

UUQDKNfOYNwuiyA8c7mxSA.text: Me & my boyfriend come here a lot & try to order different dishes every time. The food is AMAZING & the service is great! The staff is always friendly & welcoming & the restaurant is clean. The owner, Dutch is always out front greeting people & ensuring great customer service. I love Thai food & this is my favorite spot by far! I highly recommend this place if you love Thai food like I do!

fsUllPLpXuCX6U8qQ7gc4A.text: Overall the place was awesome. The food was great with vegan free and gluten free options. I had the Veggie Pho soup and the red snapper. The soup came with additional spice options and I asked for a gluten free soy sauce. I enjoyed having the option to spice it up on my own. The sauce for the fish was sweet but good.  But I enjoyed the customer service even more then the food. Everyone was awesome. There was not one employee who walked by me and didn't ask how I was doing or if my food was ok. It's not easy to find good customer service and authentic food in one location in Las Vegas. I would definitely recommend for Vegan and non vegan foodies.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Very pretty Red Snapper!

qgGAv7ca8xWAX_vyp_BMiA.text: The only thing this restaurant has done wrong is being 40 minutes away from my house. Got the Tom Kha Veggie souo and I was a bit surprised that it doesn't taste like normal Tom Kha but was a little sweet and had a ton more vegetables than I am used to in my Tom Kha (BIG BONUS)! Really enjoyed this soup and would absolutely get it again.   Also got the Vegan Yellow Curry and this was so good! Really wish this place was not all the way in Henderson or else I would be going there much more often. Definitely have to go back to this place when I'm in the area.  This place was excellent and I love that they have vegan options + their take out was an expected period of time, about 15 minutes. But this place was not extraordinary. Extraordinary deserves five stars. A review of excellence and a place to get my returning business gets four stars and that is definitely this place.

htkhuMxkPiP9UNdr54Yg5A.text: Found a bug on my plate and a long hair cooked into my pad thai. I've been to this place many times and never had an issue but they obviously were slacking today. I will not be back.

IfK4uWNkbjQvUHOJlBOZ_A.text: This Thai  restaurant is our new favorite.  Butterfly  tea lemongrass that turns purple when you squeeze a lemon in it.  Appetizer- Fresh  shrimp spring rolls & vegan crispy spinach.  Dinner- Won Ton soup & Green curry with chicken.

zcYraG_k5RyYGEyw5iYlcA.text: I've never eaten Thai food so this was a new experience for me!  Omigosh, the Coconut Juice was awesome in both the presentation and the taste!  "Drunken Noodles" were divine!  The Salmon Choo Chee was a bit dry but the curry sauce helped that out.  I don't recall names of the 3 appetizers we ordered, but loved them all!  The only thing I didn't care for was the setup of the tables and chairs, as well as the style of them.  The sound was pretty intense simply due to the concrete floor, plus style of tables/chairs.  So I'm not sure I'd "dine in" again but I would definitely order it to go!

LySrSlSmt6QqQQ-KnDuYOA.text: We ordered this to go. I was so excited to try this place out because so many people said it was amazing. Our order was missing a side of sauce we asked for.   I ordered Pad Thai, something I get at every Thai place.   Here's where it went wrong... as soon as I started eating this food I had a severe allergic reaction. Hives everywhere. My mouth and hands were tingly. I ended up in the hospital.   Needless to say I will never eat here again. I'm assuming they made my dish in a pan that was used for something else or add MSGs to their food. Because I've never had this problem. And it was so scary. Be careful.

2e1Lz8xXdOGaL3qXmLLcvg.text: So many people were talking about how good this place was but I have to say I was a bit disappointed that their food is just mediocre. I was excited because of their large selection for vegetarians. I ordered the lunch special which is a good deal ($6.99) for tofu pad see ew and a small side of salad with an eggroll. There is the option for soup as well. My noodles only came with broccoli, which tasted as if they were about to go bad-i had to spit one out and throw out two. I'm willing to give this place another try but didn't meet the expectations, otherwise.

vhG2-QjMWzKeSyi3Vw1KtA.text: Came here on recommendation and saw this place on Instagram! Nice little restaurant next EOS gym. Food is bomb! I don't usually eat vegan but the waiter recommended to try Vegan Green Curry and it was good! I also tried Butterfly Lemongrass juice and that was super bomb! Staff is very attentive and friendly! Prompt service my family and I are definitely coming back

Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Butterfly Lemongrass Juice is legit!

hH55b0A8iKLUsLQoLkRgYQ.text: Definitely the best drunken noodles I've ever had! Super fast with with a super friendly staff. I will definitely be ordering from here again. Can't wait to try more on the menu :)

lE6oWtCQddZCPwOCedkfiw.text: A restaurant that offers excellent Thai dishes and options for my Vegan/Vegetarian/Flexitarian/Pescatarian, etc friends?..fantastic..  Service: From my visits, youre greeted immediately upon entry and seated quickly.  One server was assigned to me but others followed up with me on keeping the drinks fresh and to ensure my dishes were fine.  They have an extensive menu that's smartly divided into Vegan and Non-Vegan and I was asked if I had any questions which I appreciate.  Thai Food:  Here are my current favorites that I'll build on as I visit more.  The Tom Yum Kai Soup was loaded with chicken and mushrooms.  The broth was the perfect amount of sour.  Pad Thai with chicken at a number 6 (out of 10) spicy.  This might have been the tastiest Chicken Pad Thai I've had for 2017.  Noodles were fresh and the spiciness was perfect to the point where it wasn't uncomfortable to chew yet I was sweating.  Well done, and I'm moving to a 7 on the spiciness scale just to see what happens. =)  Ambiance:  This place is currently very popular with limited seating so it might be best to call for reservations during prime times especially with a party of 4+.  Nicely decorated with Thai influnced decorations and Murals on the wall. A flat screen TV is usually showing sporting events or the news.  Dark wooden floors and contemporary bamboo chandeliers makes for a nice dining ambiance.  Excellent quality Thai good that comes out in big portions makes me a big fan of this place.  The value is definitely there and I'm looking forward to trying more dishes in the near future.  Enjoy yourself...=)

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Pad Thai...
Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Tom Yum Kai..=)

DPkDwkpOlZmYbtpiwjg6ig.text: I love this restaurant. As a plant-based eater they have a complete menu dedicated to vegan. Their service is excellent, their food is delicious and fresh. I've eaten there three times now and I look forward to many more.

photos.caption: Photo of Thailicious Authentic Thai & Vegan - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan chocolate cheesecake. The server cut the piece in to two beautiful little pieces and decorated it for sharing.

Great place to dine,have a huge vegan option in the menu It going to be my favorite place and highly recommended to all locals & must go place!!  The owner is very young and check with every customer about the food, it's nice & great customer service by all the service team   for hospitality &  delicious food!!!

WRtjitRYRmibtgihdHt2Hg.text: This is our Go To spot for Thai food in Henderson.   The food always tastes fresh and they have options in terms of a full menu for anyone who is Vegan.  The place is pretty small so it fills up quick and wait times can be pretty long but worth it.  Must try :  The Vegan Beef Jerky is mind blowing and you'll keep asking yourself if it really isn't beef. Crispy Spring Rolls Pad Thai Pineapple Fried Rice Thai iced tea  Service is always top notch and everyone there is very helpful.

MljaYmKBPGql_IjcNQFaKg.text: I am a lucky girl! Finally a great Thai restaurant ....finally So many mediocre Thai restaurants in Las Vegas.   Thailicious knocks them all out of the ballpark!   Very high food quality  Generous portions $6.99 lunch specials Great service Quick take out  Entire Vegan menu with lots and lots of options  Call to make a reservation as there was a 20 minute wait on Monday night....it is that good!

RRWANQsKQeFBjB9F6bQTyw.text: Found this gem on a recent visit to Vegas. It's right off the freeway which is a plus, but the best part is that EVERYTHING we tried was amazing. Pork pad Thai -deliciousness.  Chicken Curry-perfectly spiced Their mango & sweet sticky rice was super yummy  Will definitely go back

fbbd0JIoyYju9sWZKAMgug.text: People have recommended this to me and omg. This is amazing. The food is affordable and great portion. The dessert is sooo good because it is so well presented and it tasted amazing. I would recommend!

mO7onxBPmM6uIQG2rIteDQ.text: They get food ready really fast when you call to pick up to go.  Love their Pad Thai and Panama curry

cYOPwLH_ZK1FucghSJe9Vw.text: Fresh, delicious, authentic Thai food! Love the Moo Ping and chicken satay. Pad See Ew pork is some of the best in town! All their curry dishes are spot on. Only caution is to watch the spice level- sometimes a bit hotter than expect.

2-IwTvuZmko65LdS2GrTTg.text: Great Thai place off the strip. We went because we are vegan but family that came along is not and there was plenty for everyone to enjoy. Very authentic Thai (I made mine spicy but beware!) and very friendly service with great atmosphere.   I'd say 60% of their clientele was there because of the vegan angle. It's good for business!

gqE2dPZCQ_b_Bas6E9EXqA.text: This place is amazing.  It's authentic and so much flavor!  Usually the flavor lacks in most Thai restaurants but this place, not at all.  Been here a couple times and if I ever want Thai food, this is always my first choice.  Love their beef jerky and their dipping sauce, the noodles are all amazing, Thai tea is refreshing and always wants second.  Everything was delicious!  Highly recommend and they have vegan options too!

K5NWvZLyrsI0NnqN2eQRrw.text: Food is great! They have an awesome lunch special. My family and I love Thai food and this is definitely our favorite restaurant to go to!

FaKnkXd1Wisq23FboJAMeQ.text: Really enjoyed our food and service again. It's always nice to be recognized as a local and welcomed back. This place gets busy and it comes in waves. We were lucky enough to get one of the last tables. Our food came out a little staggered this time. But they were super busy and likely filled about 15 to go orders in the time we were sitting there. The staff is always attentive as well so we didn't even notice the food took a few minutes longer then usual. We were also lucky enough to try a new desert item... vegan cheesecake! What a an unexpected treat. We all really liked it. This visit we brought our non vegan friend with us. He loved his dishes. He tried the avo green curry vegan style and the thailiscious rice with chicken. But his favorite might have been the vegan orange soy chicken. He will be back and of course I'll be back!

iahlhad11rOgvyxNLdtHIQ.text: Amazing vegan Thai food! The food came out fast and was fresh and delicious. We ordered the crispy eggplant (my favorite out of everything), the egg rolls, coconut soup, and tofu pad see ew.  The waitress was very nice and quick with everything and service was great.  Their was also plenty of parking and it's located in a nice area of Henderson.

2c7IjajDRiouzYDm70cziQ.text: I'm brand new to the area [moved from San Fran] and I was looking for a good Thai place to make my regular. After speaking with the staff at the counter while placing my to-go order, I know I walked into the right place.  The restaurant is nice and clean and very welcoming. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I know for sure I'll be coming back!

E00AycArvA82ryY6bnvrog.text: We had pineapple fried rice, egg rolls & chicken mongolian all was delicous will be back again & again delivery offered so super excite take out!

fcnCy5reGmXH-z7B47yQKg.text: Excellent vegan menu. We have not had anything that we didn't love. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good, vegan Thai food.

addtW5ry8hbOC-uWUH5Nrw.text: Taste is wonderful, spicy is actually spicy so beware... the texture, taste, presentation and service all good.. must visit

Qa7ygKPKmXj6hwG6PcI8aQ.text: Wow! I am impressed I didn't expect to find great Thai food in Henderson. Dutch serves delicious Thai flavors in a comfortable atmosphere I started with the crispy Spinach, deep fried spinach served with a mildly spicy sauce. Followed by a crunchy tofu salad, unfortunately I forgot the name with a supply of romaine leaves to wrap it in. Thailicious has a extensive vegan menu along with a plethora of meat dishes I will certainly return to try more of his delicious recipes.
